~Skilled in Religion~.Effect: Add your Level to Checks for knowing about religions, praying, performing sermons, faith, etc.

~Awe~.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, "cast Awe" on a Unit.
This deals 1d4 Divine Damage to enemies or heals allies for 1d4.
~Awe~.Notes: Ignores Cover. Some other Cleric spells will "cast Awe" for free.

~Blessing~.Effect:
Cast Awe on 2 Units and they become Blessed until the end of the next (or current) Combat.
Blessed Allies have +1 to all Checks. Blessed Enemies have -3 Initiative.
~Blessing~.Notes:
You can bless yourself.
Lasts until the end of the next combat encounter.

~Shielding Awe~.Effect: If the Awe heal overflows the target's Max Health, the remainder is doubled and transformed into Shielding. This Shielding stacks.
~Shielding Awe~.Notes: If the target has 29 out of 30 Health and you roll 3 on Awe, the target will be at 30 Health, and the remainder Healing is 2. The target gains 4 Shielding.

~Holy March~.Effect:
While outnumbered in Combat, you have +1 Defense.
While not, you have +2 Movement.

~Grasping Blessing~.Effect:
Cast Awe on 2 Units and they become Blessed until the end of the next (or current) Combat.
Blessed Allies have +1 to all Checks ~and become immune to Crowd Control for 1 Turn.~. Blessed Enemies have -3 Initiative ~and are Blinded for 1 Turn~.
~Grasping Blessing~.Notes:
You can bless yourself.
Lasts until the end of the next combat encounter.

~Reaping~.Effect:
Whenever a Worthy Enemy dies in combat, gain 0.05 Max Mana.
If YOU killed that Worthy Enemy, gain 0.2 instead.
~Reaping~.Notes: You can't spend Mana in fractions (usually).

~Vested Awe~.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, "cast Awe" on a Unit.
This deals 1d4 Divine Damage to enemies or heals allies for 1d4.
~If you roll maximum on the Awe die, increase it by 50%.~
~Vested Awe~.Notes: Ignores Cover. Some other Cleric spells will "cast Awe" for free.

~Herald of Radiance~.Effect:
Awe Damage and healing is 1d6 if you are at full Health.
You radiate light in a 3 meter radius.
~Herald of Radiance~.Notes: You can turn the light off at will.

~Herald of Twilight~.Effect:
Awe Damage and healing is 1d6 on targets at or below 50% Health.
You can see normally in the dark up to 5 meters away.

~Let There Be Light~.Effect: Awe now hits all Units in a 2x2 area, but can't heal yourself.

<Let There Be Darkness>.Effect: While standing in darkness or dim light, your damaging Awe has its ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type and your attacks ignore Cover.
<Let There Be Darkness>.Notes: {DiceUpgrade}. It is up to the Quest Master what is considered darkness.

<Aspect>.Effect:
You take on a shadowy or illuminated appearance for the rest of the combat. Choose one:
{Diamond} Awe deals Scourge Damage. After you cast Awe, all your future Awe's deal +1 Damage. You can't heal (with anything).
{Diamond} After you heal someone, all your future heals heal for +1.

Manual Extras: +1 in a Stat of choice (up to +4)
<Stat Bonus 4>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Double Stat Bonus>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +3, twice.

<Shadow Realm>.Effect:
A Unit within 6 meters becomes trapped in a Shadow Realm with you for 2 rounds (this and the next).
Your offensive Acts against it cast Awe on it for free while inside the Shadow Realm.
Neither of you can interact with the outside world, but can feintly see it.
Units on the outside can faintly see the two of you, as if you were ghosts.
<Shadow Realm>.Notes: The Shadow Realm is a copy of the normal world, but with no other units.

<Circle of Awe>.Effect:
Declare a 4x4 meter area. Cast Awe on all Units inside the area.
After casting Awe 3 times, reset the Cooldown of this Ability (except Awes from this Ability).

<Black Hole>.Effect:
You create a 1x1 Black Hole on an empty space.
Cast Awe for free on all enemies within 6 meters of the hole.
If a Unit gets to the center of the Black Hole, it becomes Rooted.
At the end of your turn, all Units within 6 meters of it are pulled 2 meters towards it.
<Black Hole>.Notes: If 2 Units would be pulled to the center, you choose which. The black hole's gravity works even for Units behind walls and obstacles.

<Maiming Dark>.Effect:
Triple-Stun a Unit and Single-Stunn another willing ally (not you). Then cast Awe on each.
These Units' Passive Abilities are disabled while affected.

<Healing Doubledown>.Effect: Until the end of your next turn, double all healing you and your party does.
<Healing Doubledown>.Notes: Doesn't stack with other healing multiplication effects.

<Inedianism>.Effect:
Whenever you cast a 0 Actions Class Ability or Talent, another ally gains 1 Mana.
Also, you don't need to eat or drink to live - you only need exposure to light.

Manual Extras: +1 in a Stat of choice (up to +5)
<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Mana Bonus>.Effect: Gain +1 Max Mana and +1 Known Ability.

<Edict of Awe Eternal>.Effect:
~Cast Awe twice. The dice results are increased by 50%.~
This deals 1d4 Divine Damage to enemies or heals allies for 1d4.
Passively, your Intelligence and Sense increase by 2 and you can effortlessly levitate up to 1 meter above the ground, water etc. and don't take fall Damage.

<Miracle>.Effect:
You pray with divine confidence and purpose, and, with the gods' will, you manifest your wish upon your mortal world.
Choose one of the following effects to manifest:
{Diamond} Manifest restoration: Choose a person you can touch to instantly and fully kill, resurrect or heal them, restore their body parts, injuries or handicaps, change their race, etc.
{Diamond} Manifest materialism: Create an object worth up to 5000 {Gold}Gold and make it appear out of thin air in a beacon of blinding light. Or choose an object or area worth that much and make it disappear; Units with their materialistic value worth a total of 5000 {Gold} or less also disappear.
{Diamond} Manifest fate: Determine or read the near future of one Unit.
{Diamond} Manifest mistake: Undo a recent past event that was not a Worthy Combat. You and your party remains in the present to witness the aftermath.
{Diamond} Manifest destruction: Deal 2d100 Scourge Damage spread (after rolling) as you like among Units within 10 meters.
{Diamond} Manifest development: Choose a Unit and increase up to 2 of their Stats by 1, or they permanently learn a new Basic Ability, etc.
{Diamond} Manifest creativity: Choose something else with a similar scope to do, if the gods will.
After casting Miracle, if the gods will, the Cooldown of Miracle may be reset if they deem the effect was not worthy enough.
<Miracle>.Notes: The gods' will is determined by the Quest Master. Talk to the QM about your possibilities.

Extras: One of your companions joined the inquisition.
~Join the Inquisition~.Effect:
Ask a party member Player Character to join your cause and pledge their honor to you.
They gain the Awe passive Ability (e.g. whenever they use Mana for an Ability, they cast Awe).
They also gain access to the Divine Ability List.
~Join the Inquisition~.Upgrades: There is one condition your ally must match - it can never have its Max Mana higher than yours (if it does, it becomes equal to yours).
~Join the Inquisition~.Notes:
You can only have one character who pledged for you and it must be within 100 meters to have access to all of those.
Their Awe is not improved by your Awe improvements, if you have any.

<Conviction>.Effect:
While you have even Mana, you have +1 Movement.
While you have odd Mana, your weapon attacks deal +1 Damage (or +2 if 2-Handed).

~Blessing of the Forge~.Effect:
Cast Awe on 2 Units and they become Blessed ~forever~.
Blessed Allies have ~+1 Maximum Health and +1 Initiative~. Blessed Enemies have -3 Initiative ~and their Defense becomes 0~.
~Blessing of the Forge~.Notes:
You can bless yourself. Lasts until the end of the next combat encounter.
The buffs on allies may stack indefinitely.

<Hammer of Penance>.Effect:
After the first enemy is killed every Worthy Combat, your next attack pushes the non-Epic target up to 10 meters away from you.
It takes 1d12 Damage if it collides with something.

<Chastise>.Effect: After a Unit is hit by Awe 3 times, it becomes Crippled.

~Anointing Awe~.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, "cast Awe" on a Unit.
This deals 1d4 Divine Damage to enemies or heals allies for 1d4 ~and gives their next attack 10% extra Damage (minimum 1), and reduces the Damage next time they take Damage by 10% (minimum 1) (may stack multiple times additively).~
~Anointing Awe~.Notes: Ignores Cover. Some other Cleric spells will "cast Awe" for free.

<Exigent Concession>.Effect:
Roll 1d6 again and again until your roll 1.
Heal or deal Divine Damage equal to the sum of the dice rolled (including the 1).

<Domain Missionary>.Effect:
When you get this Talent, choose an extra Ability School to Know Spells from and choose an element (Fire, Cold, Shock, Pulse or Scourge).
After you spend 5 Mana on Abilities with that damaging element, increase your or your Pledgee's Max (and current) Health or Health Regen by 10% (instantly).
<Domain Missionary>.Note: Take note of whenever you spend Mana on such Abilities. The increase is instant, and every time it increases multiplicatively, but does not include Max Health/Health Regen from items or temporary buffs.

<Holy Apex>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter area.
A giant spectral fist falls onto the ground, hitting all Units there except you for 2d10 + (Round Number d6's) Divine Damage.
<Holy Apex>.Notes: E.g. on the first round of combat, this deals 2d10 + 1d6. Second round - 2d10 + 2d6. Third round - 2d10 + 3d6. And so on. Cover is applied from above if needed.

<War Mastery>.Effect: The first time you make a weapon attack every turn, cast Awe.

<Divine Doubledown>.Effect: Until the end of your next turn, increase all Divine Damage done by you and your party by 100% (doubled).
<Divine Doubledown>.Notes: The increase stacks additively with other percent increases (e.g. 50% resistance + 100% increased Damage = 50% increased Damage).

<Hand of Obscurity>.Effect: When an ally (or you) is attacked, cast Awe on them, make them Invisible until the end of their next turn and they take no damage from that attack.

<Pledge of Another>.Effect: One more Player Character to pledge to you. They also gain the effects of Join the Inquisition.

<Heaviness of Words>.Effect: Your Abilities that cost Mana cast Awe once more for each Mana spent. You have +1 Mana.

<By My Will>.Effect: Your pledgee(s) gain all your Inquisitor Class Talents.

<Heartstopping Awe>.Effect: You can cast Spread the Awe once more per Adventure, and the target(s) must succeed a Sense Check against double your Sense or be Crippled and Silenced.

<Verdict of Conscription>.Extras: All your party members should have +1 Might.
<Verdict of Conscription>.Effect:
Your entire party of Player Characters pladge to you and gain the effects of Join the Inquisition and an Inquisitor "Choose one" Ability (e.g. Conviction or Blessing of the Forge).
Passively, gain +3 Might, and all other Player Characters in your party gain +1 Might.

~Second Soul~.Effect:
You have another Unit beside you that you control which is essentially another Player Character.
Your companion is built like a normal Level 1 Player Character, but all its stats are decreased by 1, starts with no separate Gold and can not gain Feats.
It always has the same initiative as you and Levels Up only when you Level Up.
~Second Soul~.Upgrade: For the Quest Masters, your companion counts as a normal Player Character for encounter Experience!
~Second Soul~.Notes: Come up with a story about why you have your companion and why your god allowed this or gave them to you.

~Partner in Life~.Effect:
Your companion is an alive being. It can be a sentient person of any race, except Hollow.
This companion's soul is tied to yours and viceversa - when one of you dies, the other dies as well.
Both of you gain +3 Health Regen.

~True Necromancy~.Effect:
Your companion is an undead. It can be a sentient undead person of any race (without affecting its stats) or an abstract undead creature using any race's Abilities.
This companion's life depends on yours - when you die, your companion dies as well.
Your companion takes -50% Slashing and Scourge Damage.
~True Necromancy~.Notes: If your companion dies, you can spend 1 week to "revive" someone else as your new companion.

~Guardian Angel~.Effect:
Your companion is an otherworldly celestial in material form. It can be a sentient person of any race, or an abstrat celestial creature using any race's Abilities.
Your life is tied to your companion's - when it dies, you die.
You share the your Health pool with your companion (it does not have separate separate Health). If it goes more than 10 meters away from you, it is teleported near you immediately.
You gain +10 Maximum Health.

<Blessing of Life>.Effect:
Cast Awe ~twice~ and the target(s) becomes Blessed until the end of the next (or current) Combat.
Blessed Allies have +1 to all Checks ~and +1 to all Damage instances~. Blessed Enemies have -3 Initiative ~and -1 to all Damage instances~.
<Blessing of Life>.Upgrade: On Epic Monsters, the -1 Damage only affects their first turn.
<Blessing of Life>.Notes:
You can bless yourself.
Lasts until the end of the next combat encounter.

~Awe For Corpses~.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana, "cast Awe" on a Unit.
This deals 1d4 Divine Damage to enemies or heals allies for 1d4.
~However, if there is any nearby corpse within 5 meters when you would cast Awe, you instead raise a zombie to fight for you from that corpse.~
~Awe For Corpses~.Notes: Ignores Cover. Some other Cleric spells will "cast Awe" for free. Zombies take their turn on your turn.

~Attack~.Effect: Attack an Enemy for 1d4 Damage (Pierce, Slash or Smash).
Make a melee attack for 1d4 Scourge Damage.

<Divine Transposition>.Effect: Swap places with your companion, then cast Awe on both of you.

<Ascendance>.Effect:
Your Awe has its ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.
You gain Wingspan (Cleric) and Penitence.
You start every Adventure with one extra Inspiration Point.

~Wingspan (Cleric)~.Effect: Quickly fly up to 3 meters. If you're in Worthy Combat, also cast Awe.

~Penitence~.Effect:
Make a Check with any Stat against a Unit's Charisma Check.
If you pass, it can't cast healing Spells, do Crowd Control or apply On-Roll Effects for 1 minute.
~Penitence~.Notes: Against Epic Monsters, it only last for 2 turns.

~Everlasting Sustenance~.Effect:
You stop the effects of aging on yourself and your companion.
Your companion Levels Up.

~The Clerical Trinity~.Effect:
You have a third Unit beside you that you control, which is another Player Character.
Your companion is built like a normal Level 1 Player Character, but all its stats are decreased by 1, starts with no separate Gold and can not gain Feats.
It always has the same initiative as you and Levels Up only when you Level Up.

Apply the same "soul bond death" rules as your chosen Soulwright Ability at Level 2, and apply the same bonuses to the Stats (or resistances).
~The Clerical Trinity~.Upgrade: For the Quest Masters, note that this companion also counts as a normal Player Character for encounter Experience!
~The Clerical Trinity~.Notes:
Come up with a story about why you have your companion and why your god allowed this or gave them to you.
You should now have 3 characters of Levels 1, 3 and 5.

<Army of Death>.Effect:
All your summons and minions instantly transform into Death Ghouls.
They take their turns on your turn (if they haven't already).
Death Ghouls have 15 Health, 1 in all Stats, 7 meters speed and their attacks deal 1d10 Damage.

Monster.Name: Death Ghoul
Monster.Description: After 1 minute, it transforms back to how it was previously. If your companion ghoul dies, it transforms to how it previously was (with its old Health as well). If other minions ghouls die, they remain dead.

~Attack~.Effect: Melee attack a Unit for 1d10 Damage.

<Presence of Fear>.Effect:
All enemies within 5 meters must succeed a Sense Check against Your Health Regen or be Feared.
For each Enemy Feared, cast Awe (on anyone).

<Sanctuary>.Duration: Until the start of your next turn
<Sanctuary>.Effect:
Choose a 6x6 meter area. Cast Awe on all Units there.
No Enemy can willingly enter the area or attack Units inside the area.

<The Covenant>.Effect:
All your other Characters Level Up to Level 10.
Over time, all your Characters start to resemble you (or your equiavalent if a different gender), gaining more and more of your features until they almost resemble you perfectly, with some small flaws.
Passively, gain +2 Charisma and +25% base Max Health.

<High Benediction>.Effect:
You Level Up to Level 13. Another Player Character belonging to a different player also Levels Up to Level 11.
Passively, gain +2 Sense and +25% base Health Regen.

<Wrath of the Wight King>.Effect:
You channel your sacremental magic to raise an army of undead.
If there are at least 100 corpses within 100 meters of you, roll 7d20, otherwise roll only 5d20. You raise that many corpses or minions that will fight for you.
You can have up to 250 such minions active at a time, including the ones from Awe for Corpses.
Passively, gain +1 in all Stats.

~Attack~.Effect: Attack an Enemy for 1d4 Damage (Pierce, Slash or Smash).

~Skilled in Nature~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for identifying plants, knowing about nature and the wilds, etc.

~Druidcraft~.Effect:
Every midnight, regain up to {Mana}1 Mana.

You speak Whistletone, a language made up of whistles, and are Skilled in Nature and Monstrology.
You can create harmless sensory effects, tiny weather effects or soothe mild pains.
You can speed up the growth of small plants by 1000% while channeling.
~Druidcraft~.Notes: You can do these even while Shapeshifted.

~Shapeshift~.Duration: Lasts until cancelled (0 Actions) or you Fall
~Shapeshift~.Effect:
Pick an animal from the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals`, within your Level, and instantly transform into it.
You also gain its exact Abilities and Animal Attack (see below), but can't cast Spells or use items (obviously) and your Health stays the same. For Checks, you can choose to use the animal's Stats or your Stats.
~Shapeshift~.Upgrade:
At first, you can't fly, even if your animal can. If your animal can fly, you have the Jumping Skill and you can glide (you don't take falling Damage).
From Level 6, you can fly.
~Shapeshift~.Notes:
Each Shapeshift uses half a Mana point (2 Shapeshifts = 1 Mana).
You choose what items you keep on you when Shapeshifting, and those items are 'merged' into your new form.
While Shapeshifted, you can speak, but your voice is slightly altered to match your shape (e.g. guttural for lions, high pitched for birds, etc).

~Animal Attack~.Effect: Make a melee attack for 1d6 + your Highest Stat (not the animal's).
Make a melee attack for 1d6 + your Sense (not the animal's).

~Circle of the Land~.Effect: Choose one _domain_. Each _domain_ gives you extra powers.

~Nature Domain~.Effect: You can cast Talent Abilities and Basic Spells while Shapeshifted.

~Water Domain~.Effect: Whenever you heal someone else with a Spell, heal them for another 1d4.
~Water Domain~.Notes: Only works for Acts (doesn't work for Passive or Passive-like Spells).

Combat: Immune to Slows and Hard Terrain
~Cold Domain~.Effect: You gain +4 Max Health, immunity to Slows and Hard Terrain, and you take -50% Cold Damage.

~Rough Domain~.Effect:
After you attack with a real, non-bodily weapon, your next Animal Attack deals an extra 1d4 Damage.
Stacks up to 2 times (maximum bonus of 2d4).
~Rough Domain~.Notes: Only weapons in the weapons list trigger this (e.g. not Improvised Attacks, punching, biting, etc).

<Beastly Fortitude>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift into an animal specific to your _domain_, heal for 1d4.
<Beastly Fortitude>.Notes: You are allowed to use the variant animal suggestions for each animal. Of course, some animals can correspond to multiple domains (e.g. bears can live both in nature (forests) and in cold (snowy) domains).

<Innervate>.Effect: Heal another ally for 1d10 Health and it regains 1 Mana or provides 1 more use of an Ability that is on Cooldown.
<Innervate>.Downside: Can not be cast on Druids.

Manual Extras: +1 in a Stat of choice (up to +4)
<Stat Bonus 4 Plus>.Effect:
Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.
Gain 2 more non-combat Skills.

Manual Extras: +1 in a Stat of choice (up to +4)
+1 in a Stat of choice (up to +3)
<Double Stat Bonus Plus>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4, and +1 in another Stat of choice, up to +3.

<Primal Surge>.Effect: Heal yourself for 50% of your missing Health, and all Units within 2 meters for 25% of your missing Health.

<Dazzling Miasma>.Effect:
Shoot a tainted gust of spores in a 10x1 meter line from your position.
It hits the first 2 Units it travels into.
If you hit one Unit, it takes 7d6 Poison Damage.
If you hit 2 Units, each takes 2d10 Poison Damage and is Blinded.

<Druid Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you, but your Max Mana decreases by 1 and your Health by 5. Check out the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals` and choose an Animal from the Pets section, ignoring those Level requirements!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same Initiative as yours, and can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
It has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities or Pet Attack.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Notes:
Your pet can't rise from being Fallen while in combat, even if healed.
If your pet ever dies, you can spend 8 hours inbetween Adventures to get a new pet. If you want to change your Pet and abandon your current one, you can do so inbetween Adventures, but the guilt will make you Fumbling for the next 2 Worthy Combat encounters.

~Pet Attack~.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce or Slash Damage (your choice).

The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce or Slash Damage (your choice).

<Regrowth>.Effect:
Choose a Unit.
Now and at the start of your next turn, heal it for 1d10 for each 10 Health it is missing.

<Wicked Animals>.Effect:
Call upon 2 animals, both of which are specific to your _domain_, but have Max Health as if they were 4 Levels lower than you.
They appear on the edge of the battlefield, from the wilderness, and they fight for you for up to 1 minute.
<Wicked Animals>.Notes: Both animals must be of the same type. This is considered a Spell.

<Land Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent or one more Domain.

<Landscaping>.Effect:
An area 1d8 kilometers in diameter centered on you changes to match your _domain_, and, when casting this, you can shape the earth, plants, sky, etc within 100 meters to your liking.
Also, passively, while in your _domain_, you have all your ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type (and d12's become d20's), and You automatically pass all Hard Sense Checks (that require at least 15).

<Embrace Gaia>.Effect:
You gain the effects of all (4) Domain Abilities.
While in your primary _domain_, Nature Spells cost no Mana.
You are immune to normal diseases and ailments, and you can not die from old age, but your body continues to age indefinitely.

~Wild Shape~.Duration: Lasts until cancelled (0 Actions) or you Fall
~Wild Shape~.Effect:
Pick ~up to 2 animals~ from the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals`, within your Level, and instantly transform into ~a combination of them~.
You also gain ~both of their~ exact Abilities and Animal Attack (see below), but can't cast Spells or use items (obviously) and your Health stays the same. For Checks, you can choose to use ~either~ animal's Stats or your Stats.
~Wild Shape~.Upgrade:
At first, you can't fly, even if your animal can. If your animal can fly, you have the Jumping Skill and you can glide (you don't take falling Damage).
From Level 6, you can fly.
~Wild Shape~.Notes:
For example, you could transform into a combination of Bird of Prey and Bear, resulting in a Bowlear, with Shielding and a lot of Defense! Be creative!
The animal size is either the larger or the smaller of the two - your choice.
Even if you Shapeshift into 2 combinations of a same animal, the cooldown of that animal's Ability persists (e.g. you can't use Bear's Maul twice its Cooldown, no matter what animal combination you transform into).

~Animal Attack~.Effect: Make a melee attack for 1d6 + your Sense (not the animal's).

<Forest Friend>.Effect:
You have a flying Pixie companion, a very small person with wings.
The Pixie has 5 Defense, 5 Health, 5 meters Movement Speed.
It takes its turn at the same time as you. While in combat, on its turn, it has the equivalen of 1 Action, and can either melee attack for 1 Pulse Damage or heal a non-Fallen Unit for 1 Health. Instead of that, it can also use Taunt or use consumable items like potions or scrolls.
<Forest Friend>.Upgrade:
If it goes more than 50 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned (you can summon it back by channeling for 10 minuets).
The Pixie has Charisma, Sense and Intelligence equal to yours, but its Dexterity is 0 and its Might is -5.
<Forest Friend>.Notes: The Pixie can stay in your backpack or pocket if you don't want it to take Damage. Decide with your QM whether you or the QM controls the Pixie roleplay-wise, and whether it is sentient. Have fun!

<Treesposition>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift, if you're within 1 meter of a Large or larger piece of wood, teleport 1 meter near another Large (or larger) piece of wood within 5 meters.

<Exotic Shapeshift>.Effect:
You can now Shapeshift into Exotic Animals.
You can also use Shapeshift to also transform into other people.
When you want to do this, roll a Deception check.
This check determines how close you get to the form of that person (12 or more means a perfect copy).
This copy just mimicks the look of the person, not the voice or personality.
<Exotic Shapeshift>.Notes:
You can cast your own spells while transformed into someone else.
Other people are not considered Animals, so you can't use Wild Shape to transform into a combination of a person and an Animal.

<Shapeshift Ally>.Effect:
Passively, you get 2 more uses of Shapeshift per Adventure.
Choose a willing Ally and Shapeshift them into a standard animal of your choice.
They have Animal Attack and all of the animal's Abilities.
They can cancel it for 0 Actions on their turn.

<Strangevolution>.Effect: When you gain this Talent, gain 2 racial Ablities, from any Race(s).

<Dryad Ancestry>.Effect: You can cast Spells while Shapeshifted. Gain 1 extra Max Mana and access to one more Basic Ability List of choice.

<Weirdvolution>.Effect: Gain 2 Racial Ability Choices from any Race(s).

<Evershape>.Effect: When Shapeshifting yourself, it doesn't cost Mana.
<Evershape>.Notes: This means that unless you use Shapeshift Ally, you can Shapeshift as much as you like. Note that the Cooldowns of Animal Abilities persist and don't reset.

<Werebeast Blood>.Effect: You can Shapeshift into a combination of 3 animals. You gain 7 Max Health.
<Werebeast Blood>.Upgrade: In addition, you're free to just choose one animal at first when you use Shapeshift, then freely add animals to the combination if you need their Abilities. Build-a-werebeast, step by step!

<Beastly Stamina>.Effect: For each animal, you gain an extra use of their Abilities that have a Cooldown of Once / Combat or Once / Adventure.

<Ultimate Shapeshift>.Effect:
Once per Adventure, you can transform into a Beast, Fey, Monster, Plant or Dragon you have previously interacted with that is worth at most 1000 XP using Wild Shape.
If it's an Epic Monster, you can use that many of its Abilities on your turn instead of doing your regular Action.
Also, passively, your Might and Intelligence increase by 1.

<Apex Predator>.Effect:
Your Animal Abilities have no Cooldown, their Stats are tripled, and you have an extra Half-Action per Turn while Shapeshifted.
You automatically pass all Very Hard Sense Checks (that require at least 20).

<Strong-Soul Shapeshift>.Duration: Lasts up to until Shapeshift ends
<Strong-Soul Shapeshift>.Effect:
When Shapeshifting, you gain Shielding equal to the Health of one of the animals.
When all your Shielding is destroyed, you revert back to your person form.
Also, passively, your Dexterity and Sense increase by 1.

~Day Night Cycle~.Effect:
At _day_, you can cast Nature Spells while Shapeshifted.
At _twilight_, whenever you roll maximum on a Mysticism Spell die, increase it by 50%.
~Day Night Cycle~.Upgrade:
You may spend 1 hour of non-combat to change your Known Abilities.
You always know if it's day or night, even if indoors.
~Day Night Cycle~.Notes: _Twilight_ is from 18:00 to 6:00. _Day_ is from 6:00 to 18:00.

~Moonsun Fire~.Effect: A Unit takes 1d6 + ^Your Highest Stat^ Fire Damage and is Blinded (if _day_) or True Damage and is Feared (if _twilight_).

~Improved Moonsun Fire~.Effect: A Unit takes 1d6 + ^Your Highest Stat^ ~+10% of its current Health~ Fire Damage and is Blinded (if _day_) or True Damage and is Feared ~and another ally you can see is healed for the same amount~ (if _twilight_).

<Daybreak-Nightfall>.Effect: When you pass from _day_ to _twilight_ or viceversa, regain 1 Mana or heal yourself for 5 Health.

~Day Night Power~.Effect:
At _day_, ~your Nature Spells have their Dice Upgraded and~ you can cast Nature Spells while Shapeshifted.
At _twilight_, ~your Mysticism Spells have their Dice Upgraded and~ whenever you roll maximum on a Mysticism Spell die, increase it by 50%.
~Day Night Power~.Upgrade:
You may spend 1 hour of non-combat to change your Known Abilities.
You always know if it's day or night, even if indoors.
~Day Night Power~.Notes: _Twilight_ is from 18:00 to 6:00. _Day_ is from 6:00 to 18:00. {DiceUpgrade}

<Sunrise/Moonfall>.Effect: Moonsun Fire now hits one extra target, deals 1d4 extra Damage and ignores Defense and Resistances.

<Equinox>.Effect: Your next Spell (this turn or next) casts twice.
<Equinox>.Upgrade: If you use this with Shapeshift, you can combine into 2 animals, and have both their Abilities and their highest Stats.
<Equinox>.Notes: On the second cast, you can choose different targets, areas, etc (and it ignores Cooldown, Costs, etc). Works on Spells with cast time longer than 1 Action (e.g. Old Ritualist).

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Shapeshift Fire>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift into an animal specific to the current time of day, cast Moonsun Fire for free, ignoring its Cooldown.
<Shapeshift Fire>.Notes: The chosen animal must be approved by the QM to trigger the free Moonsun Fire.

<Star Fall>.Effect: If _day_, heal a Unit for 6d12. If _twilight_, deal 7d6 Pulse Damage to a Unit.

<Forced Eclipse>.Effect: Through ancient weather witchcraft, you force 1 minute of artificial day or night in a 1km area around you.
<Forced Eclipse>.Upgrade: This can reset the Cooldown of Moonsun Fire's, once when it happens, and again when it ends.
<Forced Eclipse>.Notes: Nothing happens if used with Equinox.

<Soulfire>.Effect:
Moonsun Fire has no Cooldown.
You become immune to Fire and Scourge Damage, and to being Blinded and Feared.
Passively, you always know the locations of any living Units within 15 meters, and you gain +2 Sense.

<Be It Dawn or Dusk>.Effect:
When it breaks _day_, you heal for 50% of your Max Health.
When it breaks _twilight_, you recover 50% of your Max Mana.
Gain +1 Sense and Intelligence.

~Skilled in Hearing~.Effect: Add your Level to all Sense Checks for hearing (e.g. over-hearing dialogue, noticing unusual sounds, discerning sounds, etc).

~Skilled in Smelling~.Effect: Add your Level to all Sense Checks for sensing smells and identifying things based on their scent.

~Animal Companion~.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you! Check out the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals` and choose an Animal from the Pets section, ignoring those Level requirements!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same Initiative as yours, and can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
It has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities or Pet Attack.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
~Animal Companion~.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
~Animal Companion~.Notes:
Your pet can't rise from being Fallen while in combat, even if healed.
If your pet ever dies, you can spend 8 hours inbetween Adventures to get a new pet. If you want to change your Pet and abandon your current one, you can do so inbetween Adventures, but the guilt will make you Fumbling for the next 2 Worthy Combat encounters.

~Pet Attack~.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce or Slash Damage (your choice).

~Tumble~.Effect:
Roll 2 meters in any possible direction.
You can use when a Unit declares an attack or Ability to try to get out of Line of Sight or behind Cover.
~Tumble~.Upgrade: ^You^ can use this to make your pet tumble instead.
~Tumble~.Notes: The attack carries on if it still has Line of Sight. Otherwise, it must choose something else to do, as if the Act never happened.

~Tracker~.Effect:
You gain Skilled in Tracking.
You always know where North is in non-magical environments.
You and your pets are unaffected by Hard Terrain.

~Skilled in Tracking~.Effect: you can add your Level to all Sense checks for tracking a creature and learning about its size, if it's part of a group or pack, if it's injured or roughly how far away it is
you can add your Level to all Sense checks for tracking a creature and learning about its size, if it's part of a group or pack, if it's injured or roughly how far away it is

~Hunter Mark~.Effect:
Choose and ^Mark^ a target you can see.
Your own single target attacks and Abilities against the ^Marked^ target have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.

<Bola Shot>.Effect: After you Tumble, choose a 2x2 meter area and throw a net. Each Unit in the area take 1d4 Pulse Damage and is Slowed. If you rolled 4 for any of them, it is Rooted instead.
<Bola Shot>.Notes: Requires a Draven Net item, which can be bought for 50 gold (or freely crafted for the same price in materials). Can retrieved after every use.

<Bounty Hunting>.Effect: When your ^Marked^ target dies, you gain 1d100 {Gold}Gold and heal an ally within 6 meters for 1d8.
<Bounty Hunting>.Notes: Flavor-wise, you collect a trophy of your kill. The next time you are in a town, you redeem the Gold from selling the trophy.

<Slayer>.Effect: You always know the type of a monster. You gain a different boon when fighting an enemy of a certain type:

Values: One attack per turn against one deals extra Damage equal to your Sense
You automatically know the Stats, Health and Abilities of a Beast you're fighting (ask the QM)
When attacked by your pet, it becomes Slowed and Taunted (by your pet)
When Marking one, it must make an Intelligence Check or be Silenced or Crippled (your choice)

<Stat Bonuses 4>.Effect: Gain +1 in two Stats of choice, up to +4.

<Stat Bonus 4 Extra>.Effect: Gain +1 in three Stats of choice, up to +3.

<Crosshair Shot>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target.
For each meter to the target, the attack deals 1d6 Pierce Damage, up to 7 meters.
For each meter to the target over 7 meters, deal one less d6.
<Crosshair Shot>.Notes: At exactly 7 meters range, the attack deals 7d6 Damage. At 6 and 8 meters, it deals 6d6. At 5 and 9 meters, 5d6. And so on.

~Tag-Team Mark~.Effect:
Choose and mark a target you can see. ~Your Pet immediately dashes to the target and performs a Pet Attack if it's within 6 meters of the target.~
Your own ~and your pet's~ single target attacks and Abilities against the marked target have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.

~Chaser Mark~.Effect:
Choose and mark a target you can see. ~If it's a non-Epic Unit, it is perpetually Feared while marked and has 0 base Defense.~
Your own single target attacks and Abilities against the marked target have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.

<Tremor Wave>.Effect:
Shoot a thundering shot towards an obstacle or wall. A quaking wave travels horizontally towards in both directions of the wall up to 10 meters in each direction.
All Units within 2 meters of that wall must succeed a Might Check against 6 + ^Your Sense^ or be Triple-Stunned and take 3d4 Shock Damage.
They take half of the Damage and are Slowed if they succeed.
<Tremor Wave>.Notes: The floor and ceiling are not considered walls. The wave does not travel through them. This is considered a Spell. Ignores Cover.

<Improved Hunter Mark>.Effect: Hunter Mark makes your ^Dice^ further ^Upgraded^ to the next die type.

<Leafwalk>.Effect: You and your pet become ^invisible^. While a Unit is _leafwalking_, it heals for 1d4 whenever it does an Act. Lasts until the end of your next turn (or for 12 seconds if not in combat).

<Stat Bonuses 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in two Stats of choice, up to +5.

<Stat Bonuses 4 Extra>.Effect: Gain +1 in three Stats of choice, up to +4.

<Pierce and Cleave>.Effect:
When making a single-target attack on a Unit, your attack hits another target, depending on the weapon range:
{Diamond} If ranged, the attack hits the first Unit directly behind the main target within 3 meters of it, on a line, for 50% of the base Damage of the attack.
{Diamond} If melee, the attack hits one Unit of choice within 2 meters of the target, for 50% of the base Damage of the attack.

<Marked for Criticals>.Effect: After you use Hunter Mark (or an upgrade) on a target, it takes maximum Damage from the next dice roll.
<Marked for Criticals>.Notes: For example, after you Hunter Mark a Unit, if you attack it for 2d8 Damage, you don't roll; it just takes 16 Damage. Applies to bonuses like Dice Upgrades, Smites, etc.

<Eye of the Hawk>.Effect:
All enemies in a Worthy Combat are automatically _Marked_, and your range increases by 500% and your ^Dice^ are further ^Upgraded^ to the ^next^ die type against _Marked_ Units. After manually casting Hunter Mark, your first attack deals 50% more Damage against that Unit.
You automatically pass all Hard Dexterity Checks (that require at least 15) and your Sense and Dexterity increase by an extra 2.

<Eye of the Raptor>.Effect:
Your attacks deal maximum Damage to Units that are not _Marked_ if they are within 3 meters of you or your Pet.
You automatically pass all Hard Sense Checks (that require at least 15) and you gain +3 Sense.

~Witch Hunter~.Effect:
You have 2 {Mana} Mana that regenerates normally inbetween Adventures.
Additionally, choose a Basic Ability List from Elemental, Divine, and Arcane.
You now have access to that Basic Ability List as well, permanently.

~Quick Magic~.Effect:
After using Tumble or one of your Pet's Abilities that has a "Once / Combat" Cooldown, immediately choose and do one of the following effects:
{Diamond} Deal 1d4 Fire Damage to a Unit
{Diamond} Cast Flash
{Diamond} Cast Vault Break
~Quick Magic~.Notes:
For quick reference: Flash teleports you up to 6 meters away; Vault Break destroys a medium obstacle within 6 meters.
All of the effects have a range of 6 meters.

<Watcher Form>.Effect:
You take on a special form, called a Watcher Form.
You have +2 to all Combat Checks, +1 Defense, and, every turn, your first Attack deals +2d4 extra Damage.
<Watcher Form>.Notes: Your body becomes engulfed in a magical aura (you choose its color), your eyes glow, and you can gain other aesthetics-only body transformations.

<Chaos Form>.Effect:
You take on a special form, called a Chaos Form.
You have +2 Movement, Tumble has a Once / Turn Cooldown, and Quick Magic triggers whenever you do an Act that takes at least a Half-Action.
<Chaos Form>.Notes: Your body emanates an unusual magical vibration, your eyes turn an ethereal white or black, and you can gain other aesthetics-only body transformations.

<Focus Form>.Effect:
You take on a special stance, called a Focus Form.
You completely dodge the next physical attack you receive from a Unit. After that, immediately attack the Unit back with a 1-handed weapon.
From then on, for the rest of the Worthy Combat, heal for 1d4 Health at the start of your every Turn.
<Focus Form>.Notes: Your pupils dilate and take on a different shape, your muscles and body tense up, your wounds start to steam, and you can gain other aesthetics-only body transformations.

<Claw-Eye Coordination>.Effect: After you cast a Basic Ability that doesn't cost Mana, your Pet can immediately make a Pet Attack.

<Warden Corral>.Effect:
Declare a 6x6 meter area and it becomes engulfed in a special magical aura.
All Units have 0 Defense and their Passive Abilities don't work while in that area (including Resistances and Weaknesses).
<Warden Corral>.Notes: The area is often subtle, and only monsters with a Sense of 3 or higher notice it.

<Wind Wall>.Effect:
Use when an enemy or enemy group make an attack.
Create a thin, vertical 4x4 meter screen of powerful Wind that destroys all projectiles.
It can't be passed through from the direction it is facing towards.
Lasts for 1 minute.
<Wind Wall>.Notes:
The wall pushes objects or willing Units away from it and can be used as a platform.
If you decide to place it horizontally, it acts as Hard Terrain.

<Cursewielder (Hunter)>.Effect: After you cast an _offensive_ Spell, your next Weapon attack deals +1d6 Damage.

<Quicker Magic>.Effect:
Quick Magic also triggers whenever you spend Mana on a Spell and you get more options:
{Diamond} Cast Burning Breah
{Diamond} Cast Invigorate
{Diamond} Cast Blur

<The 3-Gate Mutagen>.Effect:
You have all 3 Level 3 Talent Witch Hunter forms and they are permanently active at all times.
You automatically pass all Hard Might and Sense Checks (that require at least equal to 15) and you gain +2 Dexterity.

<Eye of the Arcana>.Effect:
Your Damage for Quick Magic increases to 1d20 and the range (and radius if applicable) increase by 100%.
You regenerate 1d10 Mana at the start of each Combat and you gain +3 Intelligence.

~Prowl Around~.Effect: You have +2 to all Sense Checks.
~Prowl Around~.Notes: This is because of your Animal Companions roaming about.

~Stablemaster~.Effect:
You have 3 different Animal Companion pets, but only one can adventure with you at a time.
While not with you, your other Animal Companions hang out on their own in the wilderness, but no more than 5 kilometers away from you.
You can send your current companion off, then spend 30 minutes to telepathically call another one to come join you.
~Stablemaster~.Notes:
The advantage is you can use several animal Abilities that have longer Cooldowns; these are usually stronger.
It is possible that the animal you're calling can't come to your aid if you're indoors, flying or the trail you're on is too difficult. In that case, you will have to return outside or on a safe trail (QM's decision).
In that case, your current companion can not go away, either.

<Exotic Double>.Effect:
One more of your Animal Companions accompanies you while adventuring.
This Animal Companion obeys the same rules as the regular one (takes its turns, requires healing between combats, etc).
One of your 3 Animal Companions can be an Exotic Animal.
<Exotic Double>.Notes: You're instantly kicked from the group if your pets don't have names.

<Large Double>.Effect:
One more of your Animal Companions accompanies you while adventuring.
This Animal Companion obeys the same rules as the regular one (takes its turns, requires healing between combats, etc).
One of your 3 Animal Companions grows to become Large. Its Max Health increases by 25% and its attack range by 1.

<Wild Single>.Effect:
All your Animal Companions are combinations of 2 different Animals from the Animals List, and have the highest Stats of the two and both Abilities, and has 100% extra Health. All your Animal Companions must be combinations of all different Animals.
Your Animal Companion's Pet Attack Damage becomes 2d6.

<Pet Damage Bonus>.Effect: All your Animal Companions gain +2 Max Health and +1 Damage with all attacks.

<Ravage!>.Effect:
One pet makes a melee Attack for 5d6 Slash Damage.
If the target is at or below 50% Health, deal 2d6 extra Damage and the target halves all healing it receives for the rest of the encounter.
<Ravage!>.Notes: This takes 1 Action from YOU, not your pet.

<Sickem>.Effect:
Use when a Unit goes flying against its will on someone else's turn.
Your pet(s) within 5 meters of its landing place can dash to it (after it lands) and make a total of 2 Pet Attacks on it.
<Sickem>.Notes:
Goes flying means is pushed, knocked up, dragged, etc.
This uses YOUR Reaction, not your pets'.
Obviously, the pets need line of sight and can't jump through walls, or over large obstacles. Apply common sense.

<Pet Movement Bonus>.Effect: You and all your pets gain +1 Movement Speed.

<Coordinated Bite>.Effect: One enemy near each of your pets (and/or summons) becomes Single-Stunned, Blinded and Slowed.

<Call To Action>.Effect: Call to one more of your animal companions! It appears from the wilderness and fights for up to 1 minute as if it were a normal Animal Companion.

<Second Winds>.Effect: Instantly heal yourself and all your pets for 3d6.

<Shapeshifting Pet>.Effect:
Turn one of your pets into a different animal type from the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals`. If it's enhanced by a Talent, it keeps all enhancements (e.g. from Large Double).
Passively, your Pets gain +3 in all Stats, +10 Health, +2 Movement Speed and +1d4 Damage on all attacks.
<Shapeshifting Pet>.Upgrade: If you have the Wild Single Talent, you can turn a pet into a combination of 2 Animals.

<Cryptid Tamer>.Effect:
One of your Animal Companions becomes a Beast, Dragon or Insect from the `Monsters page$/Other/Monsters` worth less than 500 XP. It doesn't have a regular Pet Attack, but it has exactly the Abilities and attacks, but only 50% of its Max Health. It obeys the rest of your Animal Companion rules as normal.
Passively, your Pets automatically pass all Very Hard Sense Checks (requiring at least 20).

~Skilled in Knowledge~.Effect: Add your Level to all Intelligence Checks for knowing various simple facts about science, astronomy, trades, etc.

~Skilled in Arcane~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks related to magic (e.g. identifying spells, magic items or runes, knowledge about magic, etc).

~Magic Mastery~.Effect: Your next Spell costs 1 less Actin Point, but has all ^Dice Downgraded^ to the previous die tier.

~Adept Spellcaster~.Effect: Instead of one, pick ^two^ Level 1 Talents and ^two^ Utility Talents.

~Element Burst~.Effect:
Damage a Unit for 2d6 {Element} Damage.
Deals +1d10 Damage if the target had taken {Element} Damage this combat before.
~Click on the Spell Icon to select the preferred Element!~

~Magic Arrows~.Effect:
Shoot 3 arcane arrows. Each does 1d4 Pulse Damage.
Each arrow after the first into the same target deals only 1d2 instead.
~Magic Arrows~.Notes: When you cast this, decide the targets before rolling the dice. Roll the dice for each target at a time.

~Burning Breath~.Effect: All Units 3x3 meter area take 4 Fire Damage.
~Burning Breath~.Combo: If any affected Unit has a Combo, +50% total Damage (to all) and does not trigger the Cooldown.

~Volt Guard~.Effect:
Use when a Unit would take Damage (after roll). Negate 50% of the incoming Damage and return it back to the source as Shock Damage.
Apply a ~Combo~ to either of them.
~Volt Guard~.Upgrade: The returned Damage is a quick lightning that bends around obstacles, ignoring Cover or Line of Sight.

~Rime Shackles~.Effect:
Deal Cold Damage to a Unit equal to 1d12 + ^Its Dexterity^.
If it's Medium or smaller, Root it.
~Rime Shackles~.Combo: This either hits one more Unit within 2 meters of it, or also Single-Stuns the target.

~North Star~.Effect: You conjure a magical star that always shoots North and deals 5d10 Pulse Damage to the first Unit hit.
~North Star~.Combo: The star explodes, dealing 50% of the total Damage to all other Units within 2 meters of the hit target.
~North Star~.Notes:
You can only shoot the star towards North - without an angle.
Ask the DM which way North is (if your character knows that).

~Learn Scrolls~.Effect: If you have a Scroll that contains a Basic Ability (e.g. from Arcane, Nature, etc), you can destroy it to Know it permanently, without needing to learn it inbetween Adventures.
~Learn Scrolls~.Notes: You can not learn Class Abilities from Scrolls. Of course, you still need to spend Mana and respect the Cooldown of said Ability.

~Control Elements~.Notes:
{ElementNotes}
Apply common sense. The QM has the final word on whether something is possible.

Target a 2x2x2 meter cube containing Fire.
Choose any of the following to do with it:
🔹 Move it up to 5 meters in any direction
🔹 Extinguish it
🔹 Lower or increase its intensity or light emission by 50%
🔹 Roughly alter its shape and/or color
Variants.ElementNotes: A Unit that touches the fire takes 2 Damage.

Variants.DoWhat:
Target a 1 meter cube containing {Element}.
Choose any of the following to do with it:
🔹 Move it up to 5 meters in any direction
🔹 Destroy it

🔹 Roughly its shape and/or color
Variants.ElementNotes: Water is Hard Terrain. A Unit that touches near-boiling or near-freezing water takes 2 Damage.

~Flash~.Effect: Instantly teleport up to 5 meters away, within line of sight.
~Flash~.Notes: You take with you all items carried. Does not work if you're Rooted or stuck in place somehow.

~Magic Tricks~.Effect:
Choose one of these effects to cast:
{Diamond} Create harmless sensory effects, sparks or non-damaging heat or cold.
{Diamond} Channel to create simple, small, harmless illusions in your hand or within 3 meters.
{Diamond} Instantly clean or soil objects.
{Diamond} Control a quill with telekinesis to quickly write with it.

~Feather Fall~.Effect:
Up to 2 Units you choose will start falling gently, down to 3 meters per round.
Once the fall finishes, the spell effect ends.
~Feather Fall~.Notes:
Arcane Feathers can be bought in most towns.
For faster gameplay, you can spend 10 gold when casting the spell, and buy the feather later.

~Longblade~.Effect:
Magically extend the weapon of a willing ally you can see (or yourself) to up to 3 meters.
Its Attacks with that weapon can have up to 3 meters range.

~Magic Expertise~.Effect: At Levels 3 through 9, pick ^two^ Talents instead of one.

<Pyromancy>.Effect: After the first time you deal Area Damage to 2 or more Worthy Enemies every Turn, increase all Fire Damage you deal by 1 for the rest of the combat.

<Electromancy>.Effect: After the first time you deal Shock Damage each Turn, increase all Healing and Shock Damage you deal by 1 for the rest of the Combat.

<Arcanism>.Effect:
Your dice can't roll less than 0 (see below).
After every 5 rolled dice, increase that number by 1 this Combat.
<Arcanism>.Notes: The rolled dice carry on to the next Turn. This number can even exceed a die's highest numbe.

<Hydromancy>.Effect: After you apply Crowd Control (other than Slow) to a Worthy Enemy, increase all Cold Damage you deal by 2 for the rest of the combat.
<Hydromancy>.Notes: Hard Terrain does not count as Crowd Control. Pushing counts as Crowd Control.

~Countermagic~.Effect:
Use when a Unit you can see wants to cast a Spell. It becomes Silenced this Turn and must choose something else to do.
Apply a ~Combo~ to that Unit.

~Conduit Flow~.Effect:
Choose a Worthy Unit other than you. If Enemy, it takes 1d10 Shock Damage. Otherwise, Heal it for 1d8.
If there is another Unit within 2 meters of it, repeat Conduit Flow on the new Unit (you choose if multiple).
~Conduit Flow~.Notes: Each Unit can be affected by Conduit Flow only once per cast. Cover is calculated from Unit to Unit (as if the conduit is jumping from Unit to Unit). The conduit can be repeated on you as long as you're not the first target.

~Magic Arrow Barrage~.Effect:
Conjure floating arrows in a 3x3 area, up to 10 meters above ground.
At any point (for 0 Actions or with a Reaction), you can release these arrows downward. All Enemies hit take 2d6 Pierce Damage.
~Magic Arrow Barrage~.Upgrade: At the start of your every Turn, if the barrage is not yet released, it increases by 1 meter in size in all directions and gains 1d4 Damage when it will be released (up to +3d4 and 9x9).
~Magic Arrow Barrage~.Notes:
E.g. every turn, it goes from 3x3 to 5x5, then 7x7, then 9x9, etc and deals from 2d6 Damage to 2d6 + 1d4, then 2d6 + 2d4, etc.
The arrows disappear as soon as they hit ground, or when dismissed (all at once) for free at any point, or after 1 minute of staying in the air.

~Element Enchantment~.Effect:
Choose a metallic weapon to imbue it with {Element}.
That weapon deals +2 Damage (as part of the Attack) and the total weapon Damage becomes {Element} Damage.

~Click on the Spell Icon to select the preferred Element!~
~Element Enchantment~.Upgrade: Lasts until the end of the next (or current) combat, or for up to 24 hours.
~Element Enchantment~.Notes: Does not stack with other weapon enchantments from Spells. These are considered different Spells.

<Abjuration>.Effect:
Use when an ally (or you) would be hit by a missile (before hitting the target).
Fling it from air back to the attacker (with the exact Damage and effects).

<Animation>.Effect:
Whenever you spend Mana on a Spell that doesn't deal Damage, you can pick a Large or Medium object within 6 meters and bring it to life.
It has 3 Speed, can fly and can attack for 1d4 Smash, Slash or Pierce Damage.
Lasts 1 minute or until it takes Damage (after which it returns to its inanimate form).
<Animation>.Notes: Alternatively, it can use Sprint, Push or Taunt once.

<Illusionism>.Effect:
After you use Magic Mastery, choose an ally.
Create a clone of them on a space within 2 meters of them, and teleport the ally 2 meters in any direction (as to create a diversion).
The clone has the same Health and other stats, but takes 300% of the Damage it takes.
The clone can pretend to do anything the ally can do. If it attacks with a weapon or Spell, it can do at most 1 Psychic Damage per attack Act.
<Illusionism>.Upgrade: An enemy can't tell which Unit is real and which is the clone until the clone does something relevant and the Unit has at least 3 Intelligence.
<Illusionism>.Notes: E.g. the clone could cast Magic Missiles, but only one missile will deal 1 Damage (you can choose which, and apply Cover, Defense and other penalties normally - e.g. 1 Damage with Cover becomes 0 Damage). Alternatively, for example, it could attack twice with a one-handed weapon for 1 Damage each.

<Spellcraft>.Effect:
When you cast a spell, you can apply this any of the following effects to it:
{Diamond} For every 2 dice in its Damage, roll 1 more
{Diamond} Increase it or decrease its Area by 50% (if AoE)
{Diamond} Change its Damage type to any type
{Diamond} Increase its Stunning by 1 tier
{Diamond} Double its range
You can spend 1 {Mana}Mana to cast this ignoring its Cooldown.

<Grand Wizardry>.Effect:
Spells that cost 3 or more Mana cost 1 less for you.
Basic Spells that cost Mana and have a Cooldown have no Cooldown for you.

<Destruction>.Effect: Whenever you deal Damage with a Spell that cost Mana, zap a Unit within 4 meters for ^your Intelligence^ Shock Damage.

<Evocation>.Effect:
Take the form of an _evoker_ - a being made of pure energy.
While in the _evoker_ form, all Damage you deal from all sources becomes Pulse Damage, and all your spells that cost 2 or more Mana now cost 1 less.
You can breathe underwater and fly at normal Speed.
<Evocation>.Notes: You can't end your turn inside an obstacle, and you can't move through walls, ceilings and floors.

<Chronomancy>.Effect:
Instantly return to how and where you were at the start of your turn (or your previous turn if it's not currently your turn), with that same Movement, Actions, Health, Shielding, Buffs and Cooldowns (not Mana, though).
Alternatively, if you're out of combat, you can turn back time for all the world up to 10 minutes, exactly how it was, but retaining all your information from the future. Allies don't retain the information.

<Graviturgy>.Duration: Until the start of your next turn
<Graviturgy>.Effect:
Choose a 5x5x5 meter cube.
That area become frozen in time - Units skip their turns and can't be damaged or affected by anything.
Any object that touches the area becomes frozen, too (and, if it is a missile, resumes its trajectory when the area ends).

<Hermeticism>.Effect:
You know all Basic Spells and they all cost 1 less Mana to cast. If they cost 0 Mana, they instead restore 1 Mana if used in Combat.
You may create your own _homebrew_ Spells as per the rules of _QM Resources, Homebrewing Abilities_.
You can use Restricted Abilities even if restricted in your current adventures.

<Highmancy>.Effect: Your chosen Level 3 Talent triggers 3 times when it happens. When using Magic Mastery on a Spell with the same element as your Level 3 Talent, it no longer gets its ^Dice Downgraded^.
<Highmancy>.Upgrade: All your other Spells become themed to the same element, but keep their original Damage Type. For example, if you chose fire, Frost Nova will now burst in cold, blue flames instead of ice.
<Highmancy>.Notes: For example, when you hit multiple Units with an Ability, you increase your Fire Damage by +3 instead of +1, or you gain +6 Cold Damage from Hydromancy when you Crowd Control an Enemy. For Eldritchianism, your Spells have their ^Dice Upgraded^ 3 times.

~Unstable Spark~.Effect:
At the start of your every Turn in a Worthy Combat, roll 1d10.
If you roll 10, your first Spell this Turn has its ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die tier.

~Overcharge~.Effect: Roll an Unstable Spark die. If you roll 1, you take 4 True Damage.
~Overcharge~.Upgrade: Requires you to be in a Worthy Combat.

<Guiled Casting>.Effect: When you roll 2 on the Unstable Spark die, one random Damage Type you deal increases by 1 _forever_.

<Sap>.Effect: A Unit must succeed a Charisma Check against your last rolled Unstable Spark die or be Blinded, Silenced or Rooted (your choice).
<Sap>.Notes: What are you doing, just pick Wild Casting.

<Mild Casting>.Effect:
After you cast a Spell or one of its variants, you can't cast that spell or variant again this Combat.
Your base Unstable Spark also triggers on 9.

<Viled Casting>.Effect: All non-physical Damage you deal becomes Eldritch Damage. When you roll 5 on the Unstable Spark die, increase all Eldritch Damage you deal for the rest of the combat by 3. Then roll another Unstable Spark die.

<Wild Casting>.Effect:
When you roll the Unstable Spark die, if you roll 2 or 3, roll 1d20. Freely cast that Spell from the table below, "randomly" by the QM.
If you rolled 2 on the Unstable Spark die, the effect is negative for your team. Otherwise, it's positive.
The lower Health you are, the more intense the effect (probably).
<Wild Casting>.Notes:
For example, if you roll 2 and the random Spell is Fire Enchantment, it will be cast on an enemy's weapon if possible (respecting the range). If not possible, then it will be cast on a random, non-Player Character's weapon. If not possible, then it will be cast on a Player Character's weapon. If nothing is possible, nothing happens.
If an effect can be cancelled or has ongoing effects, you have control of them as if you yourself had cast the Spell.

SpellTable.Name: 1. Fake Sound
SpellTable.Effect: A sound is magically created at a point (it can Silence some Units).

SpellTable.Name: 2. Quicksand
SpellTable.Effect: An 3x3 to 9x9 area becomes Hard Terrain.

SpellTable.Name: 3. Conjure Steed
SpellTable.Effect: A random animal is conjured as a mount for 1 to 5 Units.

SpellTable.Name: 4. Force Wall
SpellTable.Effect: A thin 2x2 to 6x6 transparent wall is created.

SpellTable.Name: 5. Obstable Break
SpellTable.Effect: One or more obstacles or traps are destroyed.

SpellTable.Name: 6. Strange Wave
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 5 Units are Healed or Damaged for 1d4.

SpellTable.Name: 7. Teleportation
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 5 Units are teleported 1 to 10 meters.

SpellTable.Name: 8. Fog
SpellTable.Effect: A 3x3 to 9x9 fog cloud is created.

SpellTable.Name: 9. Enchanted Weapons
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 5 Units have their weapons enchanted (+2 Damage, any element)

SpellTable.Name: 10. Invisibility
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 5 Units become invisible for 1 to 99 Turns.

SpellTable.Name: 11. FULMINATION
SpellTable.Effect: A 3x3 to 9x9 explosion happens, dealing 2d6 to 6d6 Damage of any element.

SpellTable.Name: 12. Fling
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 5 objects or items are flung around. If any hits a Unit, deals 1d6 Damage.

SpellTable.Name: 13. Thunder Clap
SpellTable.Effect: All Units within 2 to 6 meters of you take 1d6 to 3d6 Damage (any type).

SpellTable.Name: 14. Wilder Casting
SpellTable.Effect: Roll 2 more times on this table.

SpellTable.Name: 15. Reverse Gravity
SpellTable.Effect: The gravity in a 3x3x3 to 9x9x9 area is reversed.

SpellTable.Name: 16. Banish
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 3 Units are banished to another plane for 1 Turn. When they come back, they immediately take 1 Turn.

SpellTable.Name: 17. Unknowable Health
SpellTable.Effect: A Unit is healed for 5 to 55 Health.

SpellTable.Name: 18. Lightning Strikes Again
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 3 Units get any Crowd Control.

SpellTable.Name: 19. Nervous System Jolt
SpellTable.Effect: One Unit permanently gains +1 in a Stat, or +1 to +3 Max Health, Regen or Mana.

SpellTable.Name: 20. Resurrection
SpellTable.Effect: 1 to 3 dead or Fallen Units come back to life (without Exhaustion) with 1 to full Health.

<Arcano Mantissa>.Effect: When you roll 4 on the Unstable Spark die, gain 0.5 Max Health and 0.25 Max Mana.
<Arcano Mantissa>.Notes: Mana and Health can't be expended or Damaged in fractions, but if you manage to get this 2 times, you essentially get +1 Health permanently (or 1 Mana permanently if you trigger this 4 times).

<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Effect:
Your Unstable Spark die becomes 1d12 instead of 1d10, and triggers on 11 and 12 instead of 10.
Your d12 dice become d14's, 1d14's become d16's, etc, when they have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die tier.
<Honorificabilitudinitatibus>.Notes: I don't know. You're a mage, figure it out.

<Second Try>.Effect: Use after you roll an Unstable Spark die. You may cancel the roll. Then roll 2 more.

<Star Burst>.Effect:
Declare up to 4 different targets you can see.
Assign a different number from #1 to #4 to each.
Roll a number of d4's equal to your last rolled Unstable Spark die. Each d4 rolled deals that much Pulse Damage to the target with that number.
Each rolled 1 deals 1 Damage to target number #1, each rolled 2 deals 2 Damage to target number #2, and so on.
<Star Burst>.Notes:
E.g. if you put #2 on a goblin, and you roll three 2's on the d4's, then that goblin takes 6 Pulse Damage.
You should probably assign the higher number to the target you want to do most Damage to.
You can declare fewer targets, but then the missing number will deal Damage to no target.
Cover is applied normally.

<Great Sorcery>.Effect: When you roll 8 or 9 on the Unstable Spark die, gain 1 Mana.

<Accidental Zap>.Effect: When you roll 6, 7 or 8 on the Unstable Spark die, immediately Zap the closest Unit to you for ^your Intelligence^ Shock Damage.

<Double Spark Triple Quark>.Effect:
You roll 2d10 now instead of just 1d10 for Unstable Spark. Apply effects for both.
If both are 10, your first Spell this turn become affected by Unstable Spark ^Dice Upgrade^ 3 times.

<Grand Sorcery>.Effect:
Arcane power flows potently through your veins! Whenever you would roll one or more Unstable Spark dice, roll 3 more.
Whenever you would roll dice for a Spell, all the dice are a baseline d10, no matter what die type it is (can still have ^Dice Upgraded^).
<Grand Sorcery>.Upgrade: Your appearance changes to reflect your sorcerer powers, resulting in glowing eyes, or your hair resembling a particular element, like fire or electricity.

<Locus of Control>.Effect:
You gain control over your own magic, and, whenever you would roll an Unstable Spark die, you can instead choose the number. In fact, whenever you roll one or more dice for a Spell, instead of rolling half of them, you can even choose the numbers.
Screw it, once per Round, when someone else would roll a die, just name what number you want and it happens!
<Locus of Control>.Upgrade: The control over magic reflects in your physical appearance, resulting in effects such as contracted pupils, uncannily smooth body and hair, or an uncoventionally toned voice.

<Draconianism>.Effect:
Your natural form changes to that of a large, winged dragon. Your base Maximum Mana increases by 150% and your base Max Health by 50%. You can fly at your normal Speed.
You must choose what color you are as a dragon. As your breath attack, you can cast any Basic Ability that deals Damage and doesn't cost Mana, and it also hits all Units within 2 meters of the main target. You also take -50% Damage from the Damage Type of your chosen Ability.
<Draconianism>.Upgrade: You can transform into your person-self at will, but, to you, your dragon form is more comfortable.

~Artificer~.Effect:
You have a set of Artificer's Tools.
Spending an amount of {Gold}Gold for its components, you can create a device that does repetitive tasks, shed light, emmits a sound or smell or paints surfaces in rough images or writing.
You can create any non-food normal weapon, armor, general good or adventurer gear item piece by spending its {Gold}Gold cost, wherever you are.
You can _dismantransmute_ any good into {Gold}Gold equal to 25% of its value (which is usually the normal sell price to a vendor).
~Artificer~.Notes: Artificer's Tools's small tasks are a non-combat. You can't use them to deal Damage, crowd control or heal. Feel free to be creative with what you can do - the tools might do other small artificer tasks as well. Ask your QM! The spent {Gold}Gold for this is used as resource for obtaining or transmuting materials.

~Spell Rifle~.Effect:
You can't cast Spells normally. You have a special weapon called a Spell Rifle that must be loaded ahead of time with ^spell bullets^ for specific Spells, using Load Spell Bullet.

Shooting a _Spell Bullet_ costs 1 less Action Point than the initial cost of the Spell (but not less than Half-Action).

~Shoot Spell Rifle~.Effect: Deal 2d8 + 1 Damage to a Unit (of any element type). Apply a ~Combo~ to it.

~Load Spell Bullet~.Duration: Bullets last until end of Adventure
~Load Spell Bullet~.Effect: Choose a Spell you have and also spend its Mana Cost. Load it into your Spell Rifle.
~Load Spell Bullet~.Upgrade: Hint: You should load your Bullets ahead of time before a Combat.

~Create Device~.Effect:
You may create Spell Bullets with Spells from other player characters. They spend the base Spell Mana cost, but only you can use these.
Other player characters can use regular Spell Bullets you give to them, without a Spell Rifle.
~Create Device~.Notes: Devices always take a Half-Action to use and can be used by anyone.

~Create Elixir~.Effect:
Choose one of the following types of potions and create it
{Diamond} Elixir of Healing - Heal for 2d6.
{Diamond} Elixir of Strength - Attacks with 2-Handed weapons deal +2 Damage, and attacks with 1-Handed weapons deal +1 Damage (lasts 1 combat encounter).
{Diamond} Elixir of Agility - Gain 100% base Movement Speed (lasts for 4 hours).
{Diamond} Elixir of Mana - Gain 1 Mana

<Create Magic Weapon>.Effect:
You create a special magical weapon.
Choose a type of weapon, and choose 2 of the following effects:
{Diamond} +1 Damage if it's a One-Handed Weapon (or +2 if it's Two-Handed)
{Diamond} Damage can freely be converted to Fire/Cold/Shock (choose one)
{Diamond} +2 meters move speed while wielding it
{Diamond} Wielder starts combat with 1d6 Shielding
You can only have 1 Magic Weapon created at a time.
The Magic Weapon is automatically destroyed after 24 hours.

<Eclecticism>.Effect: You gain access to the Nature, Mysticism, Eldritch and Divine Ability Lists to Know Basic Abilities from.
<Eclecticism>.Notes: If a Spell requires a certain Level, you need that Level to Know it, as usual.

<Create Golem>.Effect:
Choose an empty 2x2 meter space and deploy a Golem there that lasts until the end of your next Adventure.
Choose if it's made of Clay, Metal or Flesh. It has different Abilities based on its material. You can find the Golem's stats in the Pets section.
The first time you summon a Golem this Adventure, it costs 1 Mana. Then, every Golem you summon costs 1 Mana more than the previous.
<Create Golem>.Notes: The Golem has 0 initiative, so it usually takes its turn last in combat.

<Create Autoturret>.Effect:
Choose an empty space to deploy an Autoturret of that element.
On your turn, each Autoturret can attack for 1d6 Damage of the chosen type.
It has 10 Health and fails all Checks.
<Create Autoturret>.Notes: Cover from the turrets is applied normally. The turret can't move unless picked up (with a Half-Action) and dropped elsewhere (with 0 Actions).

<Create Grenade>.Effect:
Throw a grenade at a target 5x5x5 meter area.
Choose one of the following effects. It applies to all Units caught in the area.
{Diamond} Units 1d4 True Damage and are Blinded.
{Diamond} Units take 3d6 + 2 Smash, Pierce or Slash Damage (you choose) and are pushed away from the center of the area to closest space outside of the edge of the area.
{Diamond} The grenade explodes at the start of your next turn and deals Fire Damage equal to 4d6 + your Intelligence or Charisma (whichever is higher).
<Create Grenade>.Notes: Alternatively, you create the Grenade and give it to an ally to use. If you do this, only one Grenade can be thrown during a combat. A second grenade has no effect (since it's magical by nature and draws from your magic power).

<Create Magic Armor>.Effect:
You magically _enchant_ a piece of armor for the rest of the Adventure.
Apply all of the following effects to it:
{Diamond} +1 Defense
{Diamond} Choose a Damage type. Wearer takes -50% Damage from that type.
{Diamond} +2 meters Movement Speed, and the wearer can freely jump up to 2 meters (up or ahead; this still uses Movement).
{Diamond} Wearer can fly for up to 5 meters (using its movement) (after flying, it needs to land to take off again).
<Create Magic Armor>.Upgrade: Additionally, the armor can replace missing limbs with construct ones.

<Alchemy>.Effect: You can use Create Elixir 4 times per Adventure.

<Engineering>.Effect: You can use Create Device 4 times per Adventure.

<Create Replica>.Effect:
You create a replica of a non-legendary magic item.
Only one replica of that item can exist.
While the replica exists, you can't create another (you must completely destroy it first, and can do so by touching it).

<Augmentation>.Effect:
You augment your body using chemical, mechanical or magical procedures.
Your Might, Dexterity and Sense increase by 2, your Health by 10

<Transfiguration>.Effect:
You replace your body entirely with magical constructs, and transfuse your mind and consciousness into a different part of your new transcendental body, which can be entirely biological or mechanical in nature.
Your Might and Dexterity increase by 4, your base Defense is 4, and you are Skilled when doing anything with Might, Dexterity or Intelligence.            
You no longer age and you are immune to all diseases.

<Master Artifex>.Effect:
All potions and elixirs you create are 2 times as potent. Your Golems, Autoturrets and Grenades deal 100% more Damage.
Once per Adventure, you can create a Magic Item as per the _QM Resources, Homebrewing Magic Items_ page rules and spend Gold for the materials equal to half of the item's gold cost.

<Carbonic Reflection>.Effect:
You create a perfect clone of yourself, that can be biological or mechanical in nature. It resembles you identically in appearance, Stats, personality, etc.
It can cast any Basic Abilities you have access to, but can't spend Mana or use Class Abilities. You control both in Combat and they act on the same initiative.
Beware: The clone is intelligent, and while its goals are aligned with yours, it is not guaranteed to always listen to your commands and desires outside of Combat. You decide if its intelligence is natural or artificial, and if your clone is truly sentient or conscious or not.

~Faith Casting~.Effect:
You have 2 Mana Points that can't increase.
Your Mana replenishes 10 minutes after a Worthy Combat.

~Holy Grace~.Requirement: Only usable in Worthy Combat. Can't be used on Fallen Units.
~Holy Grace~.Effect:
Heal an ally for 10% of their Maximum Health (but not yourself).
Your next attack until the end of your next Turn deals extra Damage equal to the amount just healed.

~Divine Sense~.Effect: When you use this, for a brief moment, nearby holy and unholy presences emmit a subtle sound and smell ^only you can sense^.
~Divine Sense~.Upgrade: Unholiness smells sulphurous and sounds like a deep, echoing rumbling or breath. Holiness smells churchly and sounds like a reverbing crystaline ringing.
~Divine Sense~.Notes:
Walls block this smell and sound as they normally would.
This smell and sound can only be concealed with magic.

~Smite~.Effect:
After you roll Damage for a melee attack or Spell made in melee range, add 1d6 Divine Damage.
If the target dies, regain 1 Mana.
~Smite~.Notes: Melee range is 1 meter, longer if made with a Weapon with longer range.

~Invigorate~.Effect:
Heal a target for 1d4 + ^Soul or Mind^ Health.
After this, if the target is at full Health, repeat this on another target within 5 meters of you.
~Invigorate~.Combo: If the target is Comboed and still not full Health, increase the Healing by 50%.
~Invigorate~.Notes: Yes, this can chain again and again.

~Zeal~.Effect: Your first attack each Turn deals +10% Damage for each Mana you still have.
~Zeal~.Notes: 10% is easy to calculate, so calculate 10% and double it (rounded down).

~Knighthood~.Effect: While mounted, after moving in a straight line at least 3 meters, your first attack this turn also hits a Unit directly behind the main target for 50% of the incoming Damage.

~Light~.Effect:
Create a faithful source of light in a 3 meters radius (of any color).
It levitates and stays where you put it and can be moved by hand, or you can simply stick it to any solid object.
~Light~.Notes:
You may cancel it with 0 Actions. It can be purposefully destroyed with an Attack.
The light is not strong enough to blind someone.
The bulb can't go through solid objects.

~Guidance~.Effect: When an ally makes a Check, also add your respective Stat for that Check.

~Smiting Fireheart~.Effect: After you defeat a ^Worthy Enemy^, your next attack deals +50% Damage (but can't retrigger Fire Heart).

~Eye for Revolution~.Effect: Your melee attacks deal +25% Damage for each Crowd Control they have (Double-Stun and Triple-Stun count as separate). The Damage of those attacks becoms Fire.

<Jihad>.Effect:
When healing yourself with Crusade, increase the healing by 50%.
Additionally, you can heal yourself with Holy Grace.

~Crusade~.Effect: When ^YOU^ defeat one Worthy Enemy, all excess Damage is converted to healing or Divine Damage to a Unit within 5 meters of you.
~Crusade~.Notes: E.g. if a Unit has 5 Health and you deal 12 Damage, the Unit dies and you heal an ally (or yourself) for 7 Health using your Reaction, or blast another Unit for 7 Divine Damage. If you kill multiple Units at the same time, this triggers only for one of them, of your choice. Excess Damage from Crusade can also trigger Crusade.

~True Sense~.Effect:
When you use this, for a brief moment, nearby ~presences with souls~ emmit a subtle sound and smell ^only you can sense^.
A random one gets a ~Combo and is Single-Stunned~.
~True Sense~.Upgrade: Unholiness smells sulphurous and sounds like a deep, echoing rumbling or breath. Holiness smells churchly and sounds like a reverbing crystaline ringing. Normal souls smell like clean mineral water and sound like a flowing waterfall.
~True Sense~.Notes:
Walls block this smell and sound as they normally would.
The smell and sound can be concealed with magic.

~Expelling Bolt~.Effect: Shoot a magical bolt towards a Unit that deals 1d10 + (target's Movement Speed) Fire or Divine Damage to it.

~Lance Heave~.DisplayRequirement: Only usable if it hits at least 2 Units
~Lance Heave~.Effect:
Make a {Weapon} ^weapon^ attack {Effect}
~Click on the Icon to select a preferred effect!~
~Lance Heave~.Combo: Comboed Units take the original full Damage.
~Lance Heave~.Notes:
Can apply weapon effects. If the weapon effect requires a target, applies to one chosen Unit hit.
Range increases do increase the length. The Damage must the same for all Units hit. All bonuses to the attack (e.g. Smite, Cursewielder, etc) also split evenly.

Variants.Name: Lance Heave
Variants.Effect: that hits all Units in a 3-meter long line. The Damage is evenly split among all hit Units.

Variants.Name: Blade Heave
Variants.Effect: that hits all Units in a 3-meter long line. The Damage is evenly split among all hit Units.

Variants.Name: Penetrating Heave
Variants.Effect: that hits one more Unit up to 2 meters directly behind the main target.

Variants.Name: Piercing Heave
Variants.Effect: that hits one more Unit up to 2 meters directly behind the main target.

~Gaiety~.Effect: After you cast a Utility Spell, immediately make a Movement Action (for free) or apply a ~Combo~ to an ally.

~Crimson Contrition~.Effect: Whenever you deal Damage to multiple Units at the same time, increase all Divine and Fire Damage you deal by 10% for the rest of the Combat.

<Join the Crusade>.Effect: A party member pledges to you. They have the Crusade Ability, and the same Level 1 and 2 Talents (including Utility) you have..
<Join the Crusade>.Upgrade: Ask a party member to join your cause and pledge their honor to you. Write a set of vows, which your companion must vow to abide to and follow with their life, upon death do you two apart.
<Join the Crusade>.Notes:
Only one person can pledge for you and it must within sight or hearing to have access to all of those.
If you ever change this Talent, the ally loses access to all things mentioned; it regains them when you get this Talent again.

~Seal of the Aurora~.Effect: Whenever you heal a Unit to full Health, heal another Unit within 5 meters of it for 50% of the amount healed.
~Seal of the Aurora~.Upgrade: The secondary heals can trigger Seal of the Aurora again.

~Flaming Reach~.Effect:
Your second and all further melee attacks each Turn deal +1d4 Damage on targets you haven't attacked this Turn.
Their range is 3 meters and all their Damage becomes Fire.

~Exorcism~.Effect:
Deal 5d10 True Damage to a Unit.
If it's a Demon, Fiend or Undead, increase the Damage by 50%.

~Radiance~.Effect: For 1 minute, at the end of your Turn, all Units within 1 meter of you take 1d4 Divine Damage.
~Radiance~.Notes: Can't stack multiple Radiances on the same Unit.

<Golden Shield>.Effect:
A Unit you can see becomes surrounded in a divine golden shield.
Next time the Unit would take Damage, it is completely blocked.
