<Golden Shield>.Combo: Gain back the Action Point spent.

~Row Through~.Effect:
Push a medium-sized, non-Epic Unit up to 6 meters in any direction.
If it collides with something, it is Triple-Stunned and takes 1d8 Smash Damage (and it stops).
If it collided with another Unit, that Unit is also pushed in the same direction and repeats the effect of Row Through.
~Row Through~.Notes:
E.g. if it collides with a Unit, that Unit is also pushed up to 6 meters and if it collides with something, it is Triple-Stunned and takes 1d8 Damage. If that thing it collided with was a Unit, that Unit is also pushed up to 6 meters and is Triple-Stunned and so on.
"{Stunned}"

~Spreading Exigency~.Effect: When a Unit becomes Crowd Controlled, all Enemies within 3 meters of it must pass a Heart Check against your Heart Check, or also be affected by that Crowd Control.
~Spreading Exigency~.Downside: Units affected by Retribution gain +2 to the Check.

<Suspension of Belief>.Effect: The moment your Mana drops to 0, freely cast Holy Grace (or an upgrade).
<Suspension of Belief>.Notes: Be wary of your faith, though, for gods seldom hold a positive outlook on those putting their conviction on hiatus.

<Culling Smite>.Effect:
After you roll for a melee attack, add 3d6 Divine Damage.
If the target does not die, refresh 1 Mana.
<Culling Smite>.Notes: Can not be used at the same time with other "Smite" Abilities.

<Lay on Hands>.Effect: Heal a Unit you can see for 50% of its Max Health.

~Bravery Despite Fear~.Effect: Reset the Cooldown of a different Ability.

<Personal Squire>.Effect:
You recruit a squire - a trusted NPC who gains combat powers. However, the capabilities of your squire are random: roll 1d6 to determine the type of your squire, based on the Squires category at Pets and Animals (1. Bold, 2. Sneaky, 3. Clever, 4. Wise). The Race is determined by the QM or by circumstance.
On its turn, it can do one Pet Attack, cast one Ability it has, or do the equivalent of a Half-Action (e.g. Dash, Push, etc).
You can recruit one squire per Adventure, but only one can follow you in your adventures at a time.
At the start of every Adventure (and when you get this Talent), you must spend 1 Mana and train your Squire to permanently increase its Health by 2 or gain one Ability from any other Squire type.
<Personal Squire>.Upgrade: If your squire drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your squire's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Personal Squire>.Notes: Your squire is not a Player Character by any means and does not behave like one (it can't use Weapons, Armor, Feats, Abilities, etc like a Player Character can). It is limited to what its stat block and Abilities say it can do. You can, however, give it orders, customize its looks (hair style, clothes, etc) and it will obey your commands within reason. You are the leader it looks up to. Lead proudly and fairly!

~Squire Attack~.Effect: Deal 1d6 Damage of the weapon's type, or do the equivalent of a Half-Action (e.g. Sprint, Push, etc).

<Harrowing Judgement>.Effect:
Choose a Unit with 50% or less Health.
A colossal spectral lance hits it and ^crushes it to death^.
<Harrowing Judgement>.Upgrade: Against Epic monsters, the threshold is 15% or less Health instead.
<Harrowing Judgement>.Note:
You always know if a Unit would die from this (ask the QM).
The Unit dies.

~Crimson Grace~.Requirement: Only usable in Worthy Combat. Can't be used on Fallen Units.
~Crimson Grace~.Effect:
~Deal 2 + Your Level Divine Damage to a Worthy Enemy.~
~An ally you see is healed for half of the Damage done.~

<Aspect of Ascension>.Effect:
You burst with angelic wings and burning vim.
Until the end of your next turn, you have 50% extra Movement and can fly, and can cast unlimited Abilities that cost Mana, ignoring the Mana cost and the limits of Faith Casting.
<Aspect of Ascension>.Upgrade: You can't use the same Basic Ability twice on the same turn.
<Aspect of Ascension>.Notes: E.g. let's say you used Smite last turn. This turn you activate Aspect of Ascension. You make a 1-Handed weapon attack, and add Smite to it as well. Next turn, you cast Solace Wave and Hand of Freedom, then make anther attack to which you add Smite. Then, you end your turn and Aspect of Ascension ends. You can now still cast Solace Wave and Hand of Freedom once.

<Legion of Oathsworn>.Effect:
In a place sanctified and pure, you start your own order of knights. Create a set of vows that your knights will abide to and have to recite to join you on your conquest.
You recruit a 3 beginner adventurer NPCs as squires! Each is one of the 4 possible squire types from the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals`: Bold, Sneaky, Clever or Wise, whichever makes sense the most (or random). All your squires must be different types.
Passively, gain +2 in all Stats.
<Legion of Oathsworn>.Upgrade: If your squire drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your squire's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Legion of Oathsworn>.Notes: Your squire is not a Player Character by any means and does not behave like one (it can't use Weapons, Armor, Feats, Abilities, etc like a Player Character can). It is limited to what its stat block and Abilities say it can do. You can, however, give it orders, customize its looks (hair style, clothes, etc) and it will obey your commands within reason. You are the leader it looks up to. Lead proudly and fairly!

~Squire Attack~.Effect: Deal 1d6 Damage of the weapon's type, or do the equivalent of a Half-Action (e.g. Sprint, Push, etc).

<March of the Chosen>.Effect:
Your entire party joins the crusade! All player characters in your party have the Crusade Ability, the same Tier 1 Talent you have and access to the Divine Ability List.
Also, your entire party gains +1 Might and +1 Charisma.

<Laying Waste>.Effect:
After you use Basic Ability that costs Mana with Faith Casting, reset the Cooldowns of all your Paladin Talents.
Passively, you gain +3 Might.
<Laying Waste>.Notes: Flaming Reach bonus Damage stacks with itself.

~Holy Tome Casting~.Effect:
You do not use Mana.
~Twice per~ Worthy Combat, you can cast ~any Ability~ that costs Mana, ignoring the Mana cost ~and Cooldown~.
~Holy Tome Casting~.Notes: You lose access to Innate Grace and your other Talents if you don't have the book somewhere at hand, such as hanging by your belt, in your hand or in your pocket. Should you lose the book, you can buy another one for 200 Gold at a respective temple.

~Innate Grace~.Effect: All your Divine Basic Spells have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.

~Golden Grace~.Requirement: Only usable in Worthy Combat. Can't be used on Fallen Units.
~Golden Grace~.Effect: Heal an ally for ~33% (a third)~ of their Maximum Health (but not yourself).

<Assistance From Afar>.Effect: Use when an ally inflicts Crowd Control. That Crowd Control is transformed into a better effect.
<Assistance From Afar>.Upgrade:
^Slowed^ becomes ^Rooted^.
^Fumbling^ becomes ^Feared^.
Any other harder Crowd Control becomes ^Stunned^.
<Assistance From Afar>.Notes: Hard Terrain is not Crowd Control. All Crowd Controls harder than Slowed, Fumbling, etc become Triple-Stunned.

<Devotion Aura>.Effect: All allies on your team have +1 Defense if their Defense is 0.

<White Knighthood>.Effect: While at or below 35 Health and wearing white clothes, all your Divine Basic Spells have their ^Dice^ further ^Upgraded^ to the next die type, on top of the upgrade from Divine Grace.

<Divine Blast>.Effect: Deal 1d8 Damage for each Spell you cast this combat, all to a Unit.
<Divine Blast>.Upgrade: You can apply Smites to this attack and they count as a Spell cast for this effect.

<Chrism Ritual>.Effect: Up to 3 party members gain Max Health (and Health) equal to their Health Regen.

<Life Echo>.Effect:
You put a Life Echo on another ally.
Whenever YOU heal a different Unit, the Unit with the Life Echo on them is also healed for 50% of that amount.

<Divine Resurgence>.Effect: All other Player Characters you healed this combat gain an extra Half-Action on their next turn.

<Asceticism>.Effect: For 1 minute, all Healing you do is increased by 50%, but all Damage you deal is reduced by 50%.

<Echoing Self>.Effect: A spectral self appears at the position where you started your turn, and repeats all Acts you have already done this turn.
<Echoing Self>.Notes:
An Act is considered any Movement, attack or Ability that took at least 0 Actions (does not include Passives that triggered and _echoes_ that had already happened this turn).
The clone moves exactly as you did (can go through Units) and repeats the Spells and Attacks on the same targets. If there were any dice rolls, the clone rolls them (don't use the same numbers rolled). The clone is a separate special Unit - self effects apply to the clone (and thus self-heals have no effect).

<Messiah's Grace>.Effect:
Heal an ally ~you can see~ for ~50%~ of their Maximum Health. Your next attack deals extra Damage equal to ~half~ the amount just healed.
Also, gain +2 Intelligence and +2 Sense and you become immune to curses, diseases and poisons.

~Conviction Casting~.Effect:
You do not use Mana.
~During~ Worthy Combats, you can cast ~any Ability~ that costs Mana, ignoring the Mana cost ~and Cooldown~.
Also, gain +3 Sense and you may read, understand and speak any language.

~Blockade~.Effect:
When another ally is targeted and attacked (after the roll), dash to the closest space to that ally.
You take the Damage instead of the ally, and the Damage is reduced by 2.
~Blockade~.Notes: Acts as if the attack targeted you instead of the ally (apply your own Defense, Resistances, etc). Cover is stil applied as to the ally, though.

~Silver Grace~.Requirement: Only usable in Worthy Combat. Can't be used on Fallen Units.
~Silver Grace~.Effect:
Heal an ally for 20% of their Maximum Health. ~You can target yourself.~
Your next attack deals extra Damage equal to the amount just healed.
~While at or below 50% Health, this extra Damage deals 100% more Damage, even if you cast Silver Grace before being at or below 50% Health.~

<Fellowship Aura>.Effect:
You stand out for allies near you.
Enemy ranged attacks against other allies within 1 meter of you have Cover.
<Fellowship Aura>.Notes: Nothing happens if an ally near you already has Cover. If playing on a grid, this does work for allies diagonally.

<Martyrdom>.Effect:
Use when an ally (or you) falls to 0 Health.
Immediately cast Holy Grace (or an upgraded version), ignoring its Cooldown and the Fallen Unit limitation.
<Martyrdom>.Notes: If that Fallen ally was healed, it Rises without Exhaustion.

<Knight in Black>.Effect:
You are Trained in all Weapons.
You are immune to being Slowed, Rooted and Feared.
While there are no allies within 4 meters of you, all your weapon attacks and self healing have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next dice type.
<Knight in Black>.Notes:
{DiceUpgrade}.
While _alone_, your healing Abilities have their Dice Upgraded when healing yourself.

<Man of Steel>.Effect: If you're wearing Heavy Armor or a Shield, you have +1 Defense and +5 Max Health.

<Broken Hearts>.Effect: All Damaged Enemies within 4 meters of you 2d4 + 1 True Damage and are Feared.
<Broken Hearts>.Notes: Cover is applied normally. Enemies with full Health are not affected.

<Warrior Spirits>.Effect:
Whenever you heal someone else, summon a Warrior Spirit in any space near the target, with Health equal to the amount restored.
Warrior Spirits have 4 Speed and can attack for 1d4 Divine Damage. They take their turn after yours.

<Avenging Blockade>.Effect:
When another ally is targeted and attacked (after the roll), dash to the closest space to that ally.
You take the Damage instead of the ally, and the Damage is reduced by 2, ~then you can immediately make an attack (freely) with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon on the attacker that deals -50% Damage (if it's within 3 meters of you).~
<Avenging Blockade>.Notes: If the 1-Handed Weapon is not equipped, you quickly and freely equip it, attack, then switch back to your previous weapons.

<Vows of Unbreaking>.Effect:
Your Max Health (without buffs/items) increases by 100% and you become immune to curses, diseases and poison.
You automatically pass all Very Hard Might Checks (requiring at least 20).

<Vows of Truth>.Effect:
You may use Blockage an unlimited number of times per Round (ignoring its Reaction limit). The first time you use Blockade every Round, you take no Damage.
You gain +1 Might and Charisma and you automatically pass all Hard Charisma Checks (requiring at least 15).
Upon taking the Vows of Truth, you become incapable of telling lies, and you will only tell the truth as you see it (or avoid it).

~Skilled in Stealth~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for hiding, remaining quiet, moving silently, blending in a crowd, etc.

~Ambush~.Effect: Every Worthy Combat, your first weapon attack deals +1d8 Damage.
~Ambush~.Upgrade: At Level 2, your Specialization will greatly improve your Ambush.

~Stalking~.Effect:
On the first Round of combat, you can skip your Turn.
Then, you can start your Turn whenever you like (even during enemies' turns)!
~Stalking~.Notes:
Be careful: if you don't start your Turn this Round, you lose your Turn!
If you want to start during an enemy's Turn, you do so when they declare they want to do something or after they finish doing something.

~Roguish Talents~.Effect: As a Rogue, you don't have Mana. However, your Level 4, 6 and 8 Talents have special powerful effects, and the rest of your Abilities are stronger than average.

~Backstabbing Ambush~.Effect: Every ~Turn~, your first weapon attack deals +1d8 Damage ~if there is an ally of yours near the target~.

~Fool's Gold~.Effect: After you Ambush, gain {Gold}Gold equal to all the Damage done by the attack.
~Fool's Gold~.Notes: Lore-wise, as a Thief, you prepare and build up momentum in combat. When you reach a town, you put your preparations in motion and gain the gold. Feel free to them

<Jack of Many Trades>.Effect:
You have 2 Mana that replenishes inbetween Adventures.
Also, gain 2 non-Combat Skills of choice.
<Jack of Many Trades>.EffectGreen: If you're playing with Rogue B, also gain access to the Arcane and Mysticism Ability Lists.

<Verge of the Coin>.Effect: Whenever YOU would Damage an Enemy leaving it at 10% Health or below, it dies, and you gain Gold equal to its Maximum Health.

<Hide In Plain Sight>.Effect:
On the first Round of combat, enemies with less than 3 Sense can't see you.
Also, you can always Break your Movement.
<Hide In Plain Sight>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4, and +1 in another Stat of choice, up to +3.
<Hide In Plain Sight>.Upgrade: Out of combat, you gain +2 on Checks for sneaking or hiding.

<Bounty Appraisal>.Effect:
When Worthy Combat starts, the Quest Master determines which is the most powerful enemy.
When that enemy dies, heal an ally for 1d8 and gain {Gold}Gold equal to 1000% of the amount healed.
<Bounty Appraisal>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Magic Trickster>.Effect:
You gain access to the Arcane and Mysticism Basic Ability Schools
Whenever you heal or deal Damage with a Spell to a Worthy Enemy, gain {Gold}Gold equal to the 50% of Damage or Healing done.
<Magic Trickster>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.
<Magic Trickster>.Notes: You lose access to these Spells if you change this Talent.

<Trap Wires>.Effect:
When combat starts, deploy a number of Trap Wires equal to ^your Intelligence or Sense^, anywhere on the battlefield.
A Trap Wire is thin and up to 3 meters long, and must be deployed between 2 obstacles.
Units with less than 3 Sense can't see the Trap Wires.
If a Unit touches a Trap Wire, it takes 1d10 Shock damage and become Slowed.
<Trap Wires>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set item, which can be bought for 100 gold (or freely crafted for the same price in materials).

<Blade Tempest>.Effect:
Throw 8 shurikens: one towards each direction (north, north-east, east, south, etc).
Each shuriken travels 4 meters, deals 2d6 Slash Damage to all Units it passes through, then stops in place.
At the end of your next turn, each shuriken returns to you, dealing 2d6 Slash Damage again to all Units it passes through.
<Blade Tempest>.Notes: Requires 8 Special Shuriken items, which can be bought for a total of 120 gold (or freely crafted for the same price in materials). If you're playing on a Grid, take semi-hitting into account for blades that don't travel squares exactly in the 8 directions. Cover applies normally to each blade.

<Moneycraft>.Effect: Spend 400 {Gold}Gold to permanently improve a piece of equipment. Depending on its type (armor or weapon), roll on the table below to determine the effect you get.
<Moneycraft>.Upgrade: A piece of equipment can be improved any number of times, but every extra improvement costs twice as much as its previous improvement.

<Gold_Hoard>.Effect: You gain various bonuses based on how much gold you are carrying.

Values: +10% gold that YOU find and get from Abilities
-10% Damage from all sources (applied after all other calculations)

<Finders Keepers>.Effect: When looting a _lootable object_ that _contains Worthy items_, you can spend any amount of gold to also loot an item worth up to twice the spent amount.
<Finders Keepers>.Notes: It is up to the Quest Master what a _lootable object_ is (could be a chest, the corpse of an enemy, etc). Also, it is up to the Quest Master what _Worthy items_ means (could be main quest items, magic items, or just a normal chest).

<Minor Golden Ambush>.Effect: When you Ambush, spend 10% of your carried total {Gold}Gold (minimum 100) to add +1d8 Damage.
<Minor Golden Ambush>.Notes: You need to have this gold on you.

<Minor Savage Ambush>.Effect: When you Ambush, if the target also has 50% or less Health (before your attack's Damage), the attack deals +1d6 Damage.

<Minor Icebreaker Ambush>.Effect: When you Ambush a Unit that has full Health, the attack deals +1d6 Damage.

<Minor Isolated Ambush>.Effect: When you Ambush a Unit, if there are no other Units within 1 meter of it (except you), the attack deals +1d6 Damage.

<Spellkill>.Effect:
Passively, you gain access to an Ability School of choice to Know Abilities from.
After you Ambush, your next 1-Mana Spell this turn costs no Mana.
<Spellkill>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Sharp Toss>.Effect: This turn, whenever you do an Act, flick a throwable and deal 2 Pierce Damage to a Unit.
<Sharp Toss>.Notes: Can flick needles, small knives, shuriken, etc. Sharp Toss, when cast and when thrown, is not considered an Act.
<Sharp Toss>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

~Sudden Ambush~.Effect:
Every Worthy Combat, your first weapon attack deals ~+3d6~ Damage.
~If you end a Turn without having dealt Damage, reset this.~

<Shadowpass>.Effect: Choose a point covered in shadow up to 6 meters away and teleport to it.
<Shadowpass>.Upgrades: You can use this as a Reaction when an enemy wants to attack you (before dealing the Damage). If it can't do the attack anymore, it must choose something else to do.

<Practice Makes Lethal>.Effect:
Whenever YOU kill a Worthy Enemy, gain a ^Practice Makes Lethal^ point, permanently.
Your first Damaging Attack or Ability every Worthy Combat deals extra Damage equal to your ^Practice Makes Lethal^ points.

<Enveloping Shadows>.Effect: Immediately before you Shadowpass, all Units within 1 meter from your original position must pass a Dexterity Check against your ^Movement Speed * 2^ or be Blinded.
<Enveloping Shadows>.Notes: All Units within 1 meter from where you were when you Shadowpass become Blinded.

<Critical Doubledown>.Effect:
When you ^Critical Strike^, the ^Critical Strike^ effect happens twice.
If a weapon can't do a ^Critical Strike^, it also has the following effect:
<Critical Doubledown>.EffectGreen: Critical Strike - If you rolled maximum on at least one die, deal +1 Damage if one-handed (+1d4 if two-handed).
<Critical Doubledown>.Upgrade: Note that the additional (green) Critical Strike is also doubled!

<One Turn Kill>.Effect: Whenever you take a Worthy Enemy from 50% (or more) to 0% Health in one turn, heal for 1d6 and reset the Cooldown of Shadowpass.
<One Turn Kill>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Cutting Verve>.Effect: Whenever you Ambush, you can choose one of the rolled dice and heal an ally you can see (or yourself) for that amount instead of dealing the Damage.
<Cutting Verve>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Isolation>.Effect: When Ambushing a Unit, if there is no other Unit near it (except you), the target becomes either Fumbling or Silenced (your choice).
<Isolation>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Take-Out Shadowpass>.Effect:
Choose a point covered in shadow up to 6 meters away and teleport to it.
~Your next attack makes the target roll a Might Check against the Damage done. If it fails, it becomes put to Sleep for 1 minute.~
<Take-Out Shadowpass>.Upgrades:
You can use this as a Reaction when an enemy wants to attack you (before dealing the Damage). If it can't do the attack anymore, it must choose something else to do.
~Epic monsters are instead Triple-Stunned for 1 Turn.~

<Death Mark>.Effect:
Mark a Unit you can see for death.
Whenever YOU deal Damage to it until your next turn, remember the Damage done.
At the start of your next turn, the mark bursts and the Unit takes 50% of the Damage it has taken in this time period.

<Planned Assassination>.Effect:
Name a specific Epic Unit, or a non-Epic Unit type.
Next Combat, your Ambushes deal +100% Damage against the named Unit or Unit Type.
<Planned Assassination>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Blade Verge>.Effect: Whenever YOU would Damage an Enemy leaving it at 10% Health or below, it dies.

<Shadowlayers>.Requirement: Only usable until the end of the next Turn after you Shadowpass
<Shadowlayers>.Effect: Immediately Shadowpass back to where you last Shadowpassed from (to the original position from which you Shadowpassed), then become invisible until the start of your next Turn (or for 6 seconds). Also, passively, you can use Shadowpass to instead teleport an ally instead of yourself.
<Shadowlayers>.Notes: This special Shadowpass doesn't retrigger Shadowlayers, but is improved by any Shadowpass upgrades and effects you have.
<Shadowlayers>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Ambushing Shadowpass>.Effect: After you Shadowpass, your first Damaging Attack or Spell that turn deals +1d6 Damage.

<Finale>.Effect: For each attack, Ability and application of Ambush you made this turn, deal 1d10 Damage that ignores Defense.

<Coup de Grace>.Effect:
Whenever you Ambush a Worthy Enemy, roll a Dexterity Check against ^target's total Stats sum^ to increase the Ambush dice Damage by 50%.
If you fail, your next Check increases by 50%.

~Isolated Ambush~.Effect: Every ~Turn~, your first ~attack or single-target offensive Ability against an isolated Unit~ deals +1d8 Damage.
~Isolated Ambush~.Upgrade: A Unit is _isolated_ if there are no other Units (except you) within 1 meter of it.

~Stalk 'n' Parry~.Effect:
On the first Round of combat, you can skip your Turn.
Then, you can start your Turn whenever you like (even during enemies' turns)!
~Until then, reduce any weapon attack's Damage on you by 1d6.~
~Stalk 'n' Parry~.Notes:
If you want to start during an enemy's Turn, you do so when they declare they want to do something or after they finish doing something.
Be careful: if you don't start your Turn this Round, you lose your Turn!

<Duel To Death>.Requirement: Only usable on Units with 50% or more Health
<Duel To Death>.Effect:
Challenge a non-Epic Worthy Enemy to a duel to the death!
The two of you take Turns one after another until one of you reaches 0 Health.
Neither of you can move away from eachother until the duel is over.
If you win, roll on the table to permanently improve your character!
<Duel To Death>.Notes: First, you continue your Turn; then the Enemy has its turn. After the duel is over, resume Turn order from the Unit after you. All of these Turns happen on the same Round, as if in a vaccuum (e.g. Round number does not increase).

<Swing Thing>.Effect:
Use when a Unit within 6 meters becomes affected by Crowd Control of any type except Slow.
Deal 1d10 Pierce Damage to it and push it up to 3 meters in any direction.
<Swing Thing>.Notes: Requires a Whiplash item, which can be bought for 50 gold (or freely crafted for the same price in materials).

<10 Percent Luck>.Effect: Once per Round, when you roll a 1 for a Damage die, you can reroll that die.
<10 Percent Luck>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<Opportunity Attacks>.Effect: When an enemy moves 1 or more meters away from near you, you can make a free attack on them with a 1-Handed Melee Weapon.
<Opportunity Attacks>.Notes: If you don't have a 1-Handed Weapone equipped, you automatically freely equip one, attack with it, unequip it and equip what you previously had.

<High Noon>.Requirement: Only usable on the 3rd Round of Combat
<High Noon>.Effect:
Make 6 attacks with a one-handed ranged weapon.
Further High Noon attacks on the same Unit (after the first) deal 50% less Damage.

<Exude Damage>.Effect: Your first melee attack every Turn deals Damage equal to your remaining Movement to all other Units within 1 meter of the main target.
<Exude Damage>.Notes: Excluding the main target and yourself.

<Deflect>.Effect: Reduce the Damage of a weapon attack you receive by 100%.
<Deflect>.Notes: Works for ranged weapons. Melee body parts are considered weapons.

<Puncture Wounds>.Effect: Whenever you Ambush a Unit you haven't Ambushed this Combat, heal an ally you can see (or yourself) for the number of Worthy Enemies in the Combat.

<Long Stalk 'n' Parry>.Effect:
On the first Round of combat, you can skip your Turn ~and until the end of the second Round of Combat, reduce any weapon attack's Damage on you by 1d6.~
Then, you can start your Turn whenever you like (even during enemies' turns)!
<Long Stalk 'n' Parry>.Notes:
If you want to start during an enemy's Turn, you do so when they declare they want to do something or after they finish doing something.
Be careful: if you don't start your Turn this Round, you lose your Turn!
<Long Stalk 'n' Parry>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.

<At Me!>.Effect:
After Ambushing a Unit 2 of your Turns in a row, inflict a random Crowd Control from the following options. Then the Unit becomes immune to ^At Me!^ for the rest of the Combat.
{Diamond} 1. Charm
{Diamond} 2. Silence
{Diamond} 3. Fear
{Diamond} 4. Cripple

<Critical Ambush>.Effect: Your Ambushes deal +50% Damage instead of the regular bonus Damage.

<Minor Sudden Ambush>.Effect: Every Worthy Combat, your first weapon attack deals 1d6 + 1d8 extra Damage.

<Swashbuckle>.EffectGreen: When you get this, gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Momentum Dance>.Effect: Gain Shielding equal to your current Initiative in combat.

~Skilled in Occultism~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for knowing about demons or undead, rituals, myths or cryptids, black magic, etc.

~Echoes~.Effect:
After you cast a Basic Ability, roll 1d8.
If you rolled 8 on it, the Ability _echoes_ and you cast it again (for 0 Actions), but ^all^ Damage or Healing it does is reduced by 50%.
The _echoed_ Ability can't affect the same target(s) or area.
~Echoes~.Notes:
Abilities like Recuperate can't _echo_, since the only possible target is yourself.
If the area overlaps the initial area, the overlapped part has no effect. If it hits the same target(s), it has no effect on them.
Take the Ability text as it is - _echoing_ Lightning Storm repeats the initial Damage, but you'd have to spend another 1 Action to retrigger the second Lightning Storm.
The QM has the word on whether something is possible.

~Mind Link~.Effect:
Establish a mind connection with a willing ally.
For the rest of the Adventure, you can talk to eachother telepathically.
~Mind Link~.Notes: You can only have one Mind Linked ally at a time.

~Path of the Berserker~.Effect:
Instead of having normal Health Regen, 200% of your Health Regen is added to your Max Health (and as such your Health Regen after combat is always 0).
You can not gain extra Defense except through magical means (magic items, spells, etc).
~Path of the Berserker~.Notes: Increasing Health Regen increases your Max Health instead (and losing Health Regen loses you Max Health instead).

~Cold Vigor~.Effect: Heal for 10% of your Max Health and remove diseases from yourself.

<Echoing Strikes>.Effect:
After you cast a Basic Ability ~or make a weapon attack~, roll 1d8.
If you rolled 8 on it, the Ability~/attack~ _echoes_ and you cast it again (for 0 Actions), but ^all^ Damage or Healing it does is reduced by 50%.
The _echoed_ Ability~/attack~ can't affect the same target(s) or area.
<Echoing Strikes>.Notes:
Abilities like Recuperate can't _echo_, since the only possible target is yourself.
If the area overlaps the initial area, the overlapped part has no effect. If it hits the same target(s), it has no effect on them.
Take the Ability text as it is - _echoing_ Lightning Storm repeats the initial Damage, but you'd have to spend another 1 Action to retrigger the second Lightning Storm.
The QM has the word on whether something is possible.

<Primal Trophy>.Effect:
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, gain one Primal Trophy. Every 3 Primal Trophies increase your Max Health by 1.
Every 10 Primal Trophies give you an extra non-combat Skill (make you Skilled in a type of activity).

~Bloodlust~.Effect: Add 1d4 Damage to a weapon attack for each 10 Health you are missing.
~Bloodlust~.Notes: This is not considered a Spell.

<Spirit Animal>.Effect:
A spirit animal assists you and gives you a boon, depending on its type.
You can change which spirit animal assists you while not in Combat.
<Spirit Animal>.Upgrade: The spirit animal is intangible, invulnerable and invisible to most people. You can use it to scout, but can't walk through solid surfaces. You can see through its eyes, but is bound to you and won't go more than 15 meters away from you. It does not participate in combat.
<Spirit Animal>.Notes: An Act counts as ranged if it's not made with a melee weapon, and the range is at least 3 meters

Values: You are immune to Slows and Fumbling

<Earthshattering Wave>.Effect:
All units in a line must succeed a Might Check against _10% of your Max Health_ or be Triple-Stunned. If they succeed, they become Fumbling instead.
The line is 3 meters wide, and has a length of 1 meter for ever 5 Health you are missing.
<Earthshattering Wave>.Notes:
E.g. if you have 30 out of 50 Health (thus missing 20 Health), then the line will be 4 meters long.
Cover is applied normally.

<Ruining Shout>.Effect:
Damages all Enemies within 4 meters of you.
Deals 1d6 Psychic Damage for each 1 meter to the target (up to 4d6).
Roll 4d6 at the same time, and choose which dice affect the units closer.

<Tribal Tattoos>.Effect:
Your Max Health is further increased by 8.
Every Adventure, you add another tattoo and increase it by 1.
Every 3 new tattoos, gain +1 in any Resist Check of choice.

<Jotunn>.Effect:
You grow to the size of a giant and become Large.
You gain Shielding equal to 50% of your missing Health.
Your normal Melee attacks hit all Units within 1 meter of the target for the same Damage, without the Stat modifier (e.g. you don't add your Might or Dexterity to the secondary targets).
You are immune to being Crowd Control and Hard Terrain.

<Echoes of Fury>.Effect: Your _echoes_ can hit the same target (with -50% Damage/Healing). However, if it hits a different target, the Damage or Healing is no longer reduced by 50%.

<Forced Echoes>.Notes: You don't spend Health again if any Talents require that.

~Spirit Bond~.Effect:
Establish a mind connection with an Ally you can see.
For the rest of the Adventure, you can talk to eachother telepathically, ~and whenever either of you makes a Check, add the higher bonus from either of you instead of their normal Check bonus~.
~Spirit Bond~.Notes: This does apply to non-combat Skills - if your bonded ally has a non-combat Skill, you also add the ally's Level, as it would normally make sense.

~Infinite Echo~.Effect:
After you cast a Basic Ability, roll ~1d6~.
If you rolled 6 on it, the Ability echoes and you cast it again (for 0 Actions), but all Damage or Healing it does is reduced by 50%.
The echoed Ability can't affect the same target(s) or area.
~After you echo an Ability, roll the 1d6 echo die again. If you roll 8, repeat!~
~Infinite Echo~.Upgrade: ~Your Basic Abilities can _echo_ again and again. The Damage and Healing remains 50% of its normal amount (e.g. it's not 50% of 50%).~
~Infinite Echo~.Notes:
Abilities like Recuperate can't echo, since the only possible target is yourself.
If the area overlaps the initial area, the overlapped part has no effect. If it hits the same target(s), it has no effect on them.
Take the Ability text as it is - echoing Lightning Storm repeats the initial Damage, but you'd have to spend another 1 Action to retrigger the second Lightning Storm.
The QM has the word on whether something is possible.

<Incorporeal Form>.Effect:
You become a bodyless soul for up to 8 hours and enter a willing ally.
While inside the ally's body, you can communicate with them mentally, and only they can see you.
You can slightly peek outside of their body, and move your arms, upper body and head as if you were a ghost originating from that ally's body.
{Diamond} You can't move yourself, but you always move with that ally.
{Diamond} You can't do any physical actions (because you are a ghost and can't touch anything or anyone).
{Diamond} You can cast spells normally. 
{Diamond} You follow your own Initiative in combat.
{Diamond} You can't take Damage or Crowd Control from external sources, but you feel every body sensation that ally feels.
You can freely exit their body and revert back to your physical self using 0 Actions.

<Dream Walk>.Effect:
Make a Sense Check against another non-Epic Unit's Sense Check. If you succeed, it falls Asleep for 2 turns.
Alternatively, you can use Dream Walk on an already sleeping target to alter their dreams to your liking.
<Dream Walk>.Notes: A Sleeping Unit wakes up if it takes Damage or other Crowd Control.

<Enlightening Ritual>.Effect:
You undergo an isolated, personal and mind-altering ritual with a willing non-Warlock Player Character at a campfire, and using incense, smoke and special herbs.
The ally must make a Sense Check against 6 + Your Sense.
If it succeeds, its Max Mana permanently increases by 1, and gets +2 to all Checks for the rest of the Adventure.
If it fails, it takes 1d8 Psychic Damage and gets -1 to all Checks for the rest of the Adventure.
<Enlightening Ritual>.Upgrade:
You can perform this ritual as many times as you want per Adventure until you succeed once. It costs you 1 Mana (not Max Mana), which is spent when the ally passes the ritual.
A person can only succeed one Enlightening Ritual in their lifetime.
Respeccing keeps the effects for your Ally.

<Rainmaking>.Effect:
Perform a ritual to change the weather or atmosphere on a 100 meter area (in diameter) centered on you.
Choose one option from Storm, Wind, Heat, Cold.
<Rainmaking>.Notes: In dungeons and indoors, this only goes through open doors and spaces - the weather starts from you and extends as much as possible through open holes, windows, doors, etc.

Values: Your team deals 2 extra Damage with all Spells
Your team has +1 Movement Speed, +1 Damage with missiles and can freely jump 5 meters (using Movement)
Your team deals 2 extra Damage with physical weapons

<Psyche Tether>.Effect:
Place a tether on 2 Units within 10 meters of you.
The next time one of them is Damaged or Healed, the other one takes the Damage (as Psychic Damage) or Healing as well.
<Psyche Tether>.Notes:
If both are Damaged/Healed at the same time, this only applies once and you choose which takes the Damage/Healing of the other.
The extra Damage of Smites, Ambush, etc over an attack counts as the same Damage source.

<Synchronicity>.Effect: Your _echo_ dice become 2d8 (instead of 1d8). Each rolled 8 makes the Ability Echo.

<Reincarnation>.Effect:
Use when you or an ally you can see Falls or dies. Choose an animal from the Pets and Animals list.
They immediately come to life as a translucent spirit version of that Animal.
Lasts until the ally Rises (or the animal dies too).
<Reincarnation>.Upgrade: The ally can do Animal Attack (Druid), which does 1d6 + ^their Sense^ Damage (for a Half-Action).

~Wicked Magic~.Effect: You have access to the Eldritch Spell School.

~Hex Magic~.Effect:
After you cast a Spell, you can expend 5 Health to force it to _echo_.
You can expend 3 Health to add or subtract 1d6 from any other Unit's roll (not yours).
~Hex Magic~.Notes:
The QM might not roll Damage for monsters, and instead take the average - even if they take the average, that counts as a roll.
Keep in mind you only have 1 Reaction per Round.

<Voodoo Magic>.Effect:
A Unit within 6 meters makes a Sense Check.
If it fails, it takes 2d6 Psychic Damage at the start of your every turn for 1 minute, and for its next turn, you can choose that enemy's Acts as long as it would seem reasonable to that enemy (decide with your QM).
Epic Monsters can not be controlled; they only take the Damage.
<Voodoo Magic>.Notes: For example, you can make a goblin run or recklessly attack one of your party members. But you can't make a guard jump off a cliff, because that's not what it would normally do.

<Corpseblast>.Effect:
Use the moment a Worthy Unit dies.
Explode the corpse, dealing 1d4 Poison Damage to all Units near it.
Heal for the Damage dealt.

<Blood Brew>.Effect:
You spend 10 minutes creating a strange splashable brew made from your own blood, with a random effect.
The brew can be splashed (Half-Action) onto a Unit (at 3 meters range).
When you create it, roll 1d4 to determine its effect.
You are immune to Blood Brews.
<Blood Brew>.Notes: The brews lose their effect at the end of the Adventure. Acid and Muck ignore real Cover.

Values: Target takes 1d8 Damage and becomes Blinded
Deals 1d12 Damage in a 5x5 area centered on the target, and a Toxic Gas cloud forms there.

<Bone Mass>.Effect:
Declare a square area with a diameter equal to the Health spent.
Sharp bones grow from the area (occupying 1x1 meters each).
When a Unit steps on a Sharp Bone, it directly takes 1d8 Pierce Damage and loses 1 meter of its remaining speed.
The bone then shatters.

<Dead Hands>.Effect:
Declare a square area with a diameter equal to the Health spent.
Undead hands appear in that area and make it Hard Terrain.
At the start of your next turn, summon a number of Draugr equal to half the Health spent, each wherever you choose in that area.

Monster.Name: Draugr
Monster.Description: Draugr take their turn the same time as you and you can command them to do move and attack. They can not do Default Moves or use items. Draugr last for 10 minutes or until killed.

~Attack~.Effect: Make a melee attack for 1d4 Scourge Damage.

<Schizophrenic Suggestion>.Effect:
Declare a square area with a diameter equal to ^twice the Health spent^.
All Units in that area must succeed a Sense Check agasint _twice the Health spent_ or instantly make an attack or offensive Ability of its choice, at full strength, on its closest ally.
<Schizophrenic Suggestion>.Notes: Monsters can use any of their Abilities that do Damage or Crowd Control, and target them however they want if they are Area Abilities, as long as it hits its closest ally.

<Bumboclaat!>.Effect:
Target a Unit.
The next time it would take Damage from any source before your next turn, the Damage is increased by 100%.
<Bumboclaat!>.Upgrade: You can only use this on targets that have blood.
<Bumboclaat!>.Notes: Applies to added extra Damage if it's the same type as the base Damage (e.g. Advanced Flank works, but not Smites).

<Possession>.Effect:
Choose a Unit you can see.
You possess its body and, on its next turn, you control what it does.
<Possession>.Upgrades:
Only works on targets with Sense less than 3.
The QM will tell you what the Unit can do if it's a monster.

~Warlock Mana~.Effect:
Unlike other Classes', all of your Mana regenerates 10 minutes after each Worthy combat encounter (e.g. instead of inbetween Adventures).
You gain +1 Max Mana only on Levels 3, 6 and 9 (not every Level).
~Warlock Mana~.Notes: For Feats that require you to sacrifice Mana, each Mana counts as 2 sacrificed Mana. Also, for Feats, instead of sacrificing Mana, you could sacrifice 6 Health for each Mana to sacrifice.

~Power Source~.Effect:
Your powers have an external source: a demon overlord, an unknowable eldritch entity, a blood corruption, a celestial, etc.
Pick one more Ability List to know Abilities from, which should match your power source.

~Power Overwhelming~.Effect: All your Eldritch Basic Spells have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.
~Power Overwhelming~.Notes:
{DiceUpgrade}
For example, Eldritch Blast deals 2d10, Deathflame Bolt deals 1d12 + 1d12 + 1d10, Curse of Weakness reduces by 1d6, etc.

~Shadow Veil~.Effect: You take -50% Scourge and Psychic Damage.

~Repower~.Effect: Whenever you roll maximum on a Damage die with an Eldritch Spell on a Worthy Enemy, heal for 1.

~Darkness~.Effect:
You can see in the dark.
After you spend Mana, conjure (optionally) a 3x3x3 meter area of magical darkness, centered on you. Lasts until the start of your next Turn.
~Darkness~.Notes: Units inside magical darkness are Blinded, and everything done in or through the darkness has Cover.

<Agile Development>.Effect: A Basic Spell that costs Mana and can't deal Damage costs 0 Actions once per Turn.

<Invoke Self>.Effect: Whenever you roll a d12 on a Spell, teleport 3 meters in any direction.
<Invoke Self>.Notes: You need Line of Sight to the destination point.

<Source Control>.Effect: All your Eldritch ~and Power Source chosen List~ Basic Spells have their Dice Upgraded to the next die type.
<Source Control>.Notes:
{DiceUpgrade}
For example, Eldritch Blast deals 2d10, Deathflame Bolt deals 1d12 + 1d12 + 1d10, Curse of Weakness reduces by 1d6, etc.

<Blood Pact>.Effect: This turn, all Damage you deal is increased by 50%. Every time you roll an 8 or higher on a die, take 5 Psychic Damage.
<Blood Pact>.Notes: The 50% increase is not applied to the 5 Psychic Damage.

<Extra Power>.Effect: Your Power Overwhelming makes your ^Dice^ further ^Upgraded^ to the next die type.

<Life Drain>.Effect:
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, Heal a Unit you can see for the excess Damage.
In addition, if an Enemy has 25% or less Health, you know exactly how much Health it has (ask the QM).
<Life Drain>.Notes: E.g. if the enemy has 10 Health, and you deal 16 Damage, heal an ally for 6 Health.

<Great Talent Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent, and one more Level 5 Talent.

<Final Word>.Effect: When you have exactly 1 Mana, and you cast a Spell that cost 1 Mana, that Spell casts twice (for free).
<Final Word>.Notes: This is akin to casting the Spell again for 0 Actions without spending Mana (not necessarily on the same target).

<Invoke Old God>.Effect:
You bring forth into the mortal realm a manifestation of your source of power - an old god from the `Pets and Animals page$/Other/PetsAndAnimals`.
You do not control it - it has its own Turn and Initiative in combat and possesses its own will. What will you compromise to forcefully drag an unknowable entity into the mortal plane?
Also, passively, you gain +2 Intelligence and Charisma, and you automatically pass all Impossible Intelligence Checks (requiring at least 25).

<The Dark Ritual>.Effect:
Spend any amount of Mana. Your next Spell has +50% Damage, Healing, area diameter and range for each Mana spent.
After that, restore all your Mana.

~Sentient Weapon~.Effect:
You have a Cursewielder Weapon - a special weapon of one chosen type (e.g. Shortsword, Longbow, Pike, etc). This weapon will have extra effects later on. Don't lose it!
You gain +1 in Might or Dexterity, up to +3.
~Sentient Weapon~.Upgrade: Reposess: By spending 1 hour, you can transfer the curse of your Cursewielder Weapon into another weapon. That new weapon becomes your Cursewielder Weapon, and the old one is destroyed.
~Sentient Weapon~.Notes:
You are bound by soul to your Cursewielder Weapon, inside which your patron's avatar lies, either possessing the weapon, being trapped inside it, cursing it, or using it as a means of communication with you.
You must choose your weapon type when you become a Cursewielder Warlock.
You can customize your weapon's personality, voice, the way it looks. Talk to your Quest Master.

~Cursewielder~.Effect: After you cast a Spell that costs Mana, your next Cursewielder Weapon attack deals 1d6 extra Damage (within 5 minutes).
~Cursewielder~.Notes: You can only add the 1d6 once per turn. The d6's can stack (from multiple Spells that cost Mana, one after another).

<Shapeshifting Weapon>.Effect: Instantly change the type of weapon of your Cursewielder Weapon.

<Curseweave>.Effect: After you attack a Worthy Enemy with your Cursewielder Weapon, if your next Act is a Damaging Spell that costs Mana, it deals +1d6 Damage (within 5 minutes).
<Curseweave>.Notes: Applies to Area Damage, but only applies once to Spells that hit multiple times (e.g. Magic Missile-like Spells, Damage over time effects, etc).

<Cursehelix>.Effect: You now have 1 more Cursewielder Weapon, of any kind. The same patron or another one of the same type is possessing your second weapon.
<Cursehelix>.Upgrade: Once per turn, for 0 Actions, you can vanish or resummon one of them.

<Hungering Weapon>.Effect: When YOU drop a Worthy Enemy to 0 Health, gain an extra Half-Action this turn and 5 Shielding.

<Spell Tap>.Effect: Every Worthy Combat, the moment you drop to 0 Mana, gain Shielding equal to your Max Mana and you can immediately freely (for 0 Actions) cast a Spell that doesn't cost Mana.

<Somatic Pulse>.Effect:
^Count^ the Worthy Units within 3 meters of you (including you).
They all take Pulse Damage equal to ^Counted^ d4 (except you).
<Somatic Pulse>.Notes: E.g. if this affects 3 Units, it deals 3d4. If it affects 4 Units, it deals 4d4. 5 Units - 5d4. And so on.

<Hexdrain>.Effect: Your Cursewielder (or Curseweave) Damage and heals you for the Damage done.

<Quick Hex>.Effect: Your Spells that cost Mana and can't deal Damage take 0 Actions for you, and your Cursewielder applies after you cast ^any^ Spell that costs Mana, not just offensive ones.

<Possessio>.Effect:
You become possessed by your patron or power source. While possessed, you have 1 extra Action on your turn and can't spend Mana, but you can't control your character - your patron or power source controls it (the QM).
You can suggest Actions for your possession, but your patron may act randomly or unpredictibly.
You still roll any dice for Acts your character make.
Lasts until the end of your next turn.

<Soulstealer Weapon>.Effect:
Steal the soul of a dead Worthy Unit.
Every 3 stolen souls give your Cursewielder Weapon +1 Damage permanently.
At any point, you can release all souls in your weapon to increase the Damage of the attack by 900% of the number of souls released.
<Soulstealer Weapon>.Upgrade: Dead Units whose souls are locked inside the weapon can not be revived.

<Whispers of Abeyance>.Effect:
Gain a Half-Action this Turn and get -1 in a random Stat permanently.
Upon reaching 0 or less in all Stats, you become permanently possessed by the energies residing in your Cursewielder Weapon. Each of your Stats becomes a random of 1d8 permanently.
Reaching 0 or less in all Stats immediately kills you, and both your and your patron's souls are sent to the other plane forever.
<Whispers of Abeyance>.Upgrade: Your soul is sent into a different plane, according to your patronage. From then on, you have the same body, but you are now your patron for all intents and purposes - in mind, personality and soul.

<Cursewrought Avatar>.Effect:
Throw your Cursewielder Weapon on the ground near you. It becomes a Cursewrought Avatar and immediately grows a body of its own, either ethereal, phantomatic or resembling an animated armor fused with the weapon.
The Cursewrought Avatar resembles you in all aspects, but can't cast Spells or use Abilities, and can attack only with the Cursewielder Weapon.
Spells you cast apply to the Damage of your Cursewrought Avatar for Cursewielder (or Curseweave).
<Cursewrought Avatar>.Notes: If you're not holding the Cursewielder Weapon, you obviously can't attack with it.

~Flow Tap~.Effect: Choose an enemy Unit. Cast the last Ability it cast (can include attacks).
~Flow Tap~.Notes: Includes weapon attacks, multiattacks, spells, bodily actions, etc. You can't cast Reactions, Passives or Abilities triggered through Passives. If you copied an attack, you briefly conjure a weapon for the attack only. If the Ability uses any Stats, use yours.

<Control Crowds>.Effect: Use when an enemy Unit uses an Ability. It must use a different Ability.
<Control Crowds>.Notes: If it has only one Ability or attack, you can't use Control Crowds (the QM will let you know).

<Soul Drain>.Effect:
Deal 8 Scourge Damage to a Unit.
If it dies and it was Worthy, you get the Mana back and heal you or an ally for half of the Damage done.
<Soul Drain>.Upgrade: Also, passively, you always know if a Unit would die from this (the QM will answer yes or no).

<Mana Flow Tapping>.Effect: If Flow Tap is on Cooldown, you can spend 1 Mana to cast it regardless.

<Power Tap>.Effect:
Cast an Ability one of your Allies has (with that ability's Actions and Costs and your modifiers).
If it costs Mana, you must spend its Mana.
<Power Tap>.Notes:
Does not work on Passives. The Ability must have 0, a Half-Action or 1 Actions cost.
The Cooldown applies to you - you can Power Tap an Ability that's on Cooldown. After you use it, it goes on Cooldown for you, not for your Ally.

<Patron Aspect>.Effect:
You take on the shape or a being from your patron's plane until the end of your next turn.
Your Basic Spells require no mana to cast.
After you cast a Basic Spell, it goes on a Once / Adventure Cooldown (can't be used until the next Adventure).

<Redirection>.Effect: Use when an Unit uses an Ability or attacks. Redirect it to any other valid Unit (e.g. within range). Its Damage or Healing is reduced by 50%.

<Nuissance to Gods>.Cooldown: All your Abilities with "Once / Combat" Cooldown can be used Twice / Encounter instead.

<Advanced Talent Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent, ^or^ one more Level 5 Talent.

<Curse of Domination>.Effect:
Choose a Unit you can see. Pass an Intelligence or Charisma Check at least equal to 5% of its Experience Worth to permanently put it under your control. You can command it telepathically what to and it will do your bidding.
You can only have one dominated Unit at a time and lasts until the Unit dies, until you dominate another Unit or until you willingly end the curse.
Also, passively, you gain +3 Sense.
<Curse of Domination>.Upgrade: Failing the Check makes the Unit permanently immune to Hand of Domination and it can sense they resisted an attempt of possession. A dominated Unit has the same combat capabilities and acts like themselves but is essentially a _philosophical zombie_ - they feel no emotion, have no will of their own and manifest little sentiment in their speech and expressiveness. When the Unit stops being dominated, they recall nothing that has happened in that period of time.

<Whispers of Oblivion>.Effect:
Gain a Half-Action this Turn and get -1 in a random Stat permanently.
Upon reaching 0 or less in all Stats, you become permanently possessed by the energies of your power source. Each of your Stats becomes a random of 1d8 permanently.
Reaching 0 or less in all Stats immediately kills you, and both your and your patron's souls are sent to the other plane forever.
<Whispers of Oblivion>.Upgrade: Your soul is sent into a different plane, according to your patronage. From then on, you have the same body, but you are now your patron for all intents and purposes - in mind, personality and soul.

<Mirror Mirror>.Effect:
Summon a clone of yourself on a space within 5 meters. You control the clone and it resembles you perfectly.
In Combat, the clone acts on your Turn. It has Movement of its own, but will always use its Actions to copy all Basic Abilities and Weapon Attacks you make, on the same target.
<Mirror Mirror>.Notes: The clone can't do combat Acts and fine motor skills on its own -- it will always copy yours in parallel.

~Skilled in Athletics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Might Checks for using your physical strength (e.g. lifting, breaking by hand, etc).

~Skilled in Acrobatics~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for jumping, climbing, fitting through gaps, maintaining balance and other acrobatic moves.

~Advanced Flank~.Effect:
The first time you _flank_ an enemy every turn, the attack deals +1d6 Damage.
Also, your melee weapon attacks Flank an enemy if they are pinned against a wall or an obstacle as well.
~Advanced Flank~.Note:
{Flank}
Also, instead of an ally being behind the enemy, your attacks count as Flanking even if there is a wall or another obstacle directly behind them.

~Charge~.Effect: Freely dash exactly 2 meters towards a Worthy Enemy, landing on the closest space.

~Vault Break~.Effect:
Slam the ground so hard that it shatters one obstacle that fits within a 3x3x3 meter area.
After casting this Ability, if you moved this turn, you can continue your movement.
~Vault Break~.Notes: It is the Quest Master's call if an obstacle can be broken. Most walls can't be broken, except for thinner ones and fences.

~Sound Mind Technique~.Effect: Block any negative incoming _effect_ on an ally you can see.
~Sound Mind Technique~.Upgrade: Negative effects in this case means any Crowd Control, Debuff, Curse, mind-altering magic, non-Damaging Poison, etc.

<Quick Maneuvers>.Effect: Immediately after you make a weapon attack, use Sprint, Push, Taunt or Hamstring for free.
<Quick Maneuvers>.Notes: Sprint (run up to 2 meters), Push (push a non-Epic medium-sized Unit 1 meter in any direction), Taunt (make a Unit have -2 on its next attack if it's not on you), Hamstring (slow a Unit).

~Recovery Maneuvers~.Effect: Immediately after you make a weapon attack, use Sprint, Push, Taunt or Hamstring for free ~or heal yourself for 1d4.~
~Recovery Maneuvers~.Notes: Sprint (run up to 2 meters), Push (push a non-Epic medium-sized Unit 1 meter in any direction), Taunt (make a Unit have -2 on its next attack if it's not on you), Hamstring (slow a Unit).

<Might Over Magic>.Effect:
Choose a Basic Ability from the Elemental or Nature Schools that costs 1 Mana.
You can use that Ability once per Adventure, without spending Mana.
That Ability becomes a ^physical version of itself^: instead of using magic to cast that spell, you use your body/weapons/tools.
<Might Over Magic>.Upgrade: Come up with a description of how it works! You can change this Ability inbetween Advetures.
<Might Over Magic>.Notes:
The Damage of that spell becomes Slash, Smash or Pierce, whichever makes sense.
E.g. Scorching Rays - you shoot 3 arrows with your bow (Pierce Damage).
E.g. Frost Nova - you smash the ground with such force that it Damages and Slows units around you (Smash Damage).
Be creative!

<Weaponmaster>.Effect:
Your weapon attacks have an extra effect.
When you get this, choose one weapon effect from the list below.
You also have that weapon effect on all weapons you use, exactly as written, no matter what weapon you are using.
You can change this weapon effect between combats.
<Weaponmaster>.Notes: Weapons stating "the die" (or such) now refer to any one die of the dice rolled, of choice (if multiple).

<Into the Fray>.Effect:
When combat starts, determine which side is your Allied Side and which is the Enemy Side of the battlefield. Each side has a direction (Allied Direction and Enemy Direction).
If you end your turn more to the Allied Direction than you started, you gain 4 Shielding until the start of your next turn.
If you end your turn more to the Enemy Direction than you started, your first attack next turn deals 1d6 extra Damage.

<Glory Run>.Effect:
When combat starts, a Glory Point appears behind the furthermost Enemy from you that you can see.
If you touch the Glory Point, heal for 20% of your total Health and all Enemies you can see must become Single-Stunned.
The Glory Point then disappears.
<Glory Run>.Notes: The Glory Point is not a physical thing. It's merely a concept (a point).

<Ruining Throw>.Effect:
Throw a weapon at a target and attack it (without Throwing penalties and ignoring Cover).
Before applying the Damage, the attack destroys all Shielding and Defense on the target and removes all buffs on it.
The target can't trigger "on roll", can't gain Shielding and can't benefit from Buffs until they spend an Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Upgrade: Epic Monsters gain ther Defense back when they spend the Action to recover.
<Ruining Throw>.Notes:
Your weapon lands at the nearest space to the target (and you should probably pick it up with a Half-Action).
"On roll" refers to effects like "if it rolls 10 on a d10, the attack deals 1d10 extra Damage".
Buffs are all effects that improve the target; even passive effects like auras or passive stats from abilities are negated.
You don't need Training in Throwning and this attack counts as a regular melee attack.

<Attack Command>.Effect:
An ally immediately makes an Act that takes 1 Action (can spend Mana, Cooldowns, etc on it, as if it were on its turn).
You can use this at any point, before or after someone does an Act.
^You^ roll all the dice for this Act.

<MIGHT OVER MAAAGIC!!!>.Effect:
Choose ^TWO^ Basic Abilities from the Elemental, Nature or Eldritch Schools that cost 1 Mana.
You can use each of those Abilities once per Adventure (without spending Mana).
See the Level 5 Talent _Might Over Magic_.

<Perfect Strike>.Effect:
Your next weapon attack this turn deals +300% Damage. If it kills the target, overkill Damage is dealt to all enemies within 3 meters of the main target.
Also, passively, you gain +2 Dexterity and you are immune to monster _weapon effects_ (e.g. critical strikes).

<Master Tactician>.Effect:
Gain +4 Max Health and +1 Damage on all attacks for every 3 sessions the Campaign has progressed.
From now on, at the end of every session, gain +4 Max Health and +1 Damage on all attacks.
Also, passively, gain +2 Intelligence and you know the Abilities and strategies of all enemies you encounter.

<Greatwielder>.Effect:
You can wield 2-Handed weapons, one in each hand.
Attacks like this take only a Half-Action and count as 1-Handed weapon attacks but deal -2 Damage.
While dual wielding 2-Handed weapons, if any Ability tells you to perform an attack with a 2-Handed and the ability costs 1 Action, it costs only Half-Action.
Also, passively, gain +1 Might and +1 Dexterity.
<Greatwielder>.Notes: If you already have a Technique Feat, you can remove it to refund the cost.

~Onslaught~.Effect: Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, heal for 1d6 Health. In addition, if an Enemy has 25% or less Health, you know exactly how much Health it has (ask the QM).

~Reckless Charge~.Effect:
Freely dash exactly 2 meters towards a Worthy Enemy, landing on the closest space. It becomes Rooted.
~Your next weapon attack deals 2d6 extra Damage to the target and half of that to yourself.~
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.

<Heartbeat Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Then, until the ^end^ of your next turn, you take 50% less Damage (including from your own Abilities).
When Heartbeat Trance ends, heal for 1d6.

<Rage Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Until the ^end^ of your next turn, all your attacks deal +1d4 Damage and Onslaught healing is increased by 100%.
When Rage Trance ends, heal for 1d6.

<Battle Trance>.Effect:
Take 1d6 Damage.
Until the ^end^ of your next turn, you are immune to all Crowd Control, you have +1 range on all attacks, +2 Movement, can Break your Movement.
When Battle Trance ends, heal for 2d6.

<Undying Rage>.Effect: Taking Damage that would kill you puts you in a state of primal rage, and leaves you at 1 Health instead, then you can't take damage until the start of your next turn. At the start of your next turn, heal for 2d6.

<Victory Strike>.Effect:
Attack a Unit for 2d10 Damage of your weapon's type.
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy (with anything), reset the Cooldown of this Ability.

<Frenzy>.Effect:
If you start your turn with 25 or less Health, you have +1 Movement Speed and can Break your Movement.
if you start with 15 or less Health, you also have an extra Half-Action.

<Hurl Over>.Effect:
Grab another non-Epic Unit and throw them up to 10 meters away.
Upon landing, all other Units within 3 meters of the landing place take 3d8 Pulse Damage.
If it was an Enemy, the Thrown Unit takes 50% of the Damage.

<Bloodbath>.Effect: You heal for all Damage done by Advanced Flank on Worthy Enemies.

<Flesh of Iron>.Effect:
You Heal for all Damage you would deal to yourself instead of taking it. Pierce, Slash and Smash attacks can't Damage you below 1 Health (they leave you to 1 Health).
Also, passively, you gain +2 Might.

<Ferocity Unleashed>.Effect:
If you start your turn with 50% or less Health, you have an extra 1 Action on your turn.
Also, passively, gain +1 Might, Dexterity and Sense, you are immune to exhaustion in Worthy Combat and you can survive without sleep for 7 days.
<Ferocity Unleashed>.Notes: This stacks with the Frenzy Talent.

<MIGHT BRAWN MUSCLE>.Effect: GAIN +10 MIGHT AND THE RESULTS OF ALL YOUR MIGHT CHECKS ARE DOUBLED.

~Uncharge~.Effect:
Freely dash 2 meters ~away from~ a Worthy Enemy. ~Its first attack on its next Turn deals -2 Damage.
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.

~Marksmanship~.Effect: YOU can Flank a Unit from any range (if you, the target, and the ally, wall or obstacle are on the same line).
~Marksmanship~.Notes: As usual, that ally, wall or obstacle helping with your Flank must be right behind the target (meaning allies can't Flank an enemy with you being far away).

~Load Up~.Effect:
You _load up_ your weapons. After you _load up_, your Advanced Flank die becomes 1d12 instead of 1d6, but every time you use it, the Advanced Flank die becomes ^Downgraded^ (down to 1d4).
If the attack kills the target, don't Downgrade.

<Recoiling Uncharge>.Effect:
Freely dash up to 2 meters away from a Worthy Enemy. Its first attack on its next Turn deals -2 Damage.
~If it's non-Epic, push it 2 meters away from you. If it collides with something, deal Damage with your current Advanced Flank (load up) die.~
You can only use this once on every Worthy Enemy.
<Recoiling Uncharge>.Notes: Dealing Damage with this ^Downgrades^ the Advanced Flank die.

<Harpoon Load Up>.Effect:
You _load up_ your weapons. After you _load up_, your Advanced Flank die becomes 1d12 instead of 1d6, but every time you use it, the Advanced Flank die becomes ^Downgraded^ (down to 1d4).
~If you roll maximum on the Advanced Flank die, deal an extra 1d6 Damage and either pull yourself to the target, or pull the target to you (your choice).~
If the attack kills the target, don't Downgrade.
<Harpoon Load Up>.Notes: {DiceDowngrade}. Requires a Harpoon, which can be bought for 50 Gold.

<Precise Rune>.Effect:
Craft a Precise Rune.
Inscribe on a weapon to permanently replace one Stat in its text (e.g. Might) with number 4.
The wielder of the weapon is also immune to being Crippled and has +1 Movement Speed.
<Precise Rune>.Notes: You can only have one weapon with the Precise Rune at a time. When you apply a Precise Rune to a different, the other one loses its Precise Rune.

<Ground Aim Lock>.Effect:
On your turn, you can freely lower yourself on the ground without penalties.
Your first attack every turn while on the ground like this deals +1d6 Damage.
<Ground Aim Lock>.Notes: To get up, you must use all a Half-Action.

<Scatterblast>.Effect:
Make an attack on a target for 3d8 + 2 Smash Damage.
The impact is so powerful that all Units within 3 meters of the target take the final Damage taken by the target.
This attack is affected by your Reload state.

<Surprise Shot>.Effect: Your first weapon attack every combat instantly Stuns the target.

<Offense Is Defense>.Effect: Whenever you roll maximum on the Advanced Flank die, gain Shielding equal to the roll.

<Crescendo Technique>.Effect:
When NOT flanking a Unit, whenever you make a weapon attack, make another identical attack on the same target for free that does the same Damage (but does not apply effects like Smite and weapon effects).
When you flank a Unit, it becomes Feared.
Also, passively, gain +2 Dexterity and you automatically pass Very Hard Dexterity Checks (requiring at least 20).

<Precision Perfection>.Effect: Use after rolling Damage for an attack. You can ignore all the dice rolled and just take maximum Damage for all of them.
<Precision Perfection>.Notes: Weapon effects might not trigger, since the roll was ignored.

<Make Every Shot Count>.Effect: Every time you make a weapon attack, roll 1d4 to determine an additional effect for it.

Values: Reset your Load Up to d12
Damages all Units in a 5-meter line behind the target for 100% of the Damage
Stun the target and push it 6 meters away from you

<Make Every Shot Count>.Notes: The Load Up die resets before applying it if it was applied.

Combat Extras: You can jump 3 meters without requiring a Check
~Skipper~.Effect:
Your Movement Speed is increased by 1.
You can jump 3 meters without requiring a Check (e.g. over enemies, gaps, etc).

~All Eyes and Noses~.Effect: Whenever you fail a Charisma Check, you can spend 2 Health to reroll it.
~All Eyes and Noses~.Notes: You always know if you failed a Charisma Check.

Extras: Half of your meals can consist of grass and leaves, but you can not eat meat.
~Herbivore~.Effect:
Your Might increases by 1 (up to +3), and your Max Health by an extra +1.
Half of your meals can consist of grass and leaves, but you can not eat meat.
~Herbivore~.Notes: If you eat meat, you become Exhausted for 1 hour. Remember that Might also affects Max Health!

Combat Extras: You take no extra Damage when being Flanked.
~Thick Fur~.Effect:
You only take 50% Cold Damage.
You take no extra Damage when being Flanked.
~Thick Fur~.Notes: Flanking is when you are attacked by an enemy, and there's another enemy right behind you (relative to the attacker).

Extras: You have +5 on Checks for identifying plants, fruits, mushrooms, vegetables, etc.
Combat Extras: You only take 50% Poison and Acid Damage.
~Gatherer Instincts~.Effect:
You only take 50% Poison and Acid Damage.
You have +5 on Checks for identifying plants, fruits, mushrooms, vegetables, etc.

~Innate Dexterity~.Effect: Your Dexterity increases by 1 (up to +3), and your Initiative increases by an extra +1.
~Innate Dexterity~.Notes: Remember that Dexterity also affects Initiative!

~I Am Speed~.Effect: In Abilities that use Sense, Intelligence or Charisma, you can use your Dexterity instead.
~I Am Speed~.Notes: E.g. Chilling Shout becomes 12 + ^Dexterity^ instead of 12 + ^Charisma^. Phase Orb becomes 2d6 + ^Dexterity + Dexterity^ instead of 2d6 + ^Intelligence + Charisma^.

~Alignment~.Effect:
Determine the true personality alignment of your character. Choose if you are Evil, Neutral or Virtuous. Your other Abilities must reflect your alignment.
You can't consume cooked food. If you are Virtuous, you can eat only raw vegetables and plants; if you are Evil, you can eat only raw meat; if you are Neutral, you can eat either.
~Alignment~.Notes: The QM decides if your alignment has changed based on your actions and character development. If your alignment changes throughout the adventure, your traits will automatically change to reflect your alignment.

~Davel Stare~.Effect: A target becomes Fumbling if you are Virtuous, Blinded if you are Neutral or Feared if you are Evil.

~Davel Gift~.Effect:
If you are Virtuous, heal another target for 1d10 Health.
If you are Evil, Damage another target for 1d10 Psychic Damage.
If you are Neutral, another ally gains 1 Mana and 5 Shielding, which last up to 1 minute.
~Davel Gift~.Notes: You can't cast this on yourself.

~Demonic Ancestry~.Effect: In Abilities that use Sense or Intelligence, you can use your Charisma instead.
~Demonic Ancestry~.Notes: E.g. Chilling Shout becomes 12 + ^Dexterity^ instead of 12 + ^Charisma^. Phase Orb becomes 2d6 + ^Intelligence + Dexterity^ instead of 2d6 + ^Intelligence + Charisma^.

~Stubbornness~.Effect: You gain +1 in Might and Sense Checks, and your alignment Abilities and traits can't change anymore and stay the same as they are now, even if your real alignment changes.
~Stubbornness~.Notes: That means you keep your Ability effect by alignment, food particularities, etc.

~Hellish Magic~.Effect:
You Know 2 Fire-themed Basic Abilities from any Ability List.
You can change these Abilities inbetween Adventures.
~Hellish Magic~.Notes: You still need to match the Level requirement, if any (e.g. Fireball requires Level 4).

~Slow Metabolism~.Effect:
Your lifespan increases by 50% and you can consume unlimited potions within 1 hour without overdosing.
When you drink a potion, its effect is delayed by up to 8 hours, then, at any point, you can instantly trigger the effect of the potion.
~Slow Metabolism~.Notes:
This is useful when consuming potions in combat, or when you need to quickly apply the effect of a potion.
This counts as if you consumed the potion when you use the 0 Actions, or when the 8 hours expire (e.g. for overdose).

~Wingspan~.Effect: Quickly fly up to 3 meters (e.g. almost instantly).

Combat Extras: You take -50% Damage from your chosen element.
~Dragon Ancestry~.Effect:
When creating your character, choose any element from Acid, Cold, Fire, Shock, Pulse, Poison and Scourge.
You take -50% Damage from that Damage type.
~Dragon Ancestry~.Notes: The color of your skin and scales as a Dragonsworn should reflect the element you chose (e.g. Cold might be associated with white or blue Dragonswarne).

~Dragon Breath - Area~.Effect: Breathe in a 3x3 meter area, dealing 2d6 + 2 Damage (of your Dragonsworn Element) to all Units caught in the area.
~Dragon Breath - Area~.Notes: You can use this if you didn't use it last turn.

~Dragon Breath - Line~.Effect: Breathe in a 8 meter long (1 meter thick) line~, dealing 2d6 + 2 Damage (of your Dragonsworn Element) to all Units caught in the area.
~Dragon Breath - Line~.Notes: You can use this if you didn't use it last turn.

~Dragon Breath - Blast~.Effect: Breathe on all Units within 2 meters of you, dealing 2d6 + 2 Damage (of your Dragonsworn Element) to all Units caught in the area.
~Dragon Breath - Blast~.Notes: You can use this if you didn't use it last turn.

Combat Extras: You also take -50% Damage from your 2nd chosen element.
~Second Skin~.Effect:
Choose one more Element from Dragon Ancestry
You take -50% Damage from that Damage type.
You can freely change Dragon's Breath to that element.

~Forceful Breath~.Effect: Your Dragon's Breath now deals 2d8 + 3 Damage, but is only usable Once / Combat.

~Breath Control~.Effect: All Units affected by Dragon's Breath must make a Might Check or be pushed 3 meters away from you.

~Primal Wyrmkin~.Requirement: You may only get this Ability on Character Creation
~Primal Wyrmkin~.Effect:
Your arms are covered in a membrane that spans all the way to your waist, and your form more closely resembles a feral dragon.
You get -3 Max Health and you can't use Weapons, Shields or Heavy Armor, but your Intelligence increases by 1 (up to +4), Dragon's Breath Damage deals extra Damage equal to your Intelligence, and you also gain the Wingspan Ability.

~Hulking Dracontaur~.Requirement: You may only get this Ability on Character Creation
Combat Extras: +1 Defense while Unarmored (-2 HR, -1 DEX and +1 MIG were added automatically).
~Hulking Dracontaur~.Effect:
Your lower body is 4-legged, like a draconic-centaur, and your size is Large.
You get -2 Health Regen and -1 Dexterity, but +1 Might (up to +4) and, while Unarmored, you have +1 Defense instead of +1 Movement Speed.

~Dwarf Resting~.Effect: As a Dwarf, you sleep in one single 8 hour cycle, without dreaming or moving in your sleep. You can also choose to hibernate for up to 48 hours without needing to eat or drink to cure all normal diseases and poisons on you.
~Dwarf Resting~.Notes: Loud noises and movement still wake you up as they normally would.

~Stouthearten~.Effect: You can wear an extra layer of Light or Medium armor over (or underneath) your armor. Apply all of its effects as normal.
~Stouthearten~.Notes: Unarmored is not an armor. 50% Damage reductions of the same type do not stack

~Dwarven Determination~.Effect: Use when you or an ally takes Damage that would make them fallen. That Damage is reduced by 100%.

Combat Extras: You take -50% Pulse, Falling and physical trap Damage
~Stone-Like Bones~.Effect:
Your bones are tough as rock.
You only take 50% Pulse Damage, from falling and from traps that deal physical Damage.

~Inscription Scholar~.Effect:
You can inscribe one extra Rune onto weapons.
You can inscribe one Elemental, Mind or Spirit Rune onto gloves. All Spells gain the Rune's effect when cast wearing these gloves, if possible.
~Inscription Scholar~.Upgrade: If it makes sense, you can also inscribe other more powerful Runes (Magic Items) onto gloves.
~Inscription Scholar~.Notes: Only one Rune can be inscribed onto gloves.

~Adept of the Forge~.Effect:
Spend 1 hour at a forge while in a friendly town to craft an artisanal 2-handed weapon or an armor, that's made of metal.
Spend {Gold}Gold equal the item's base cost.
If it's a 2-handed weapon, it deals +1 Damage. If it's an armor, its wearer has +2 Max Health.
~Adept of the Forge~.Upgrade: If the weapon baseline contains any wood, increase the cost by 50% {Gold}Gold.
~Adept of the Forge~.Notes: For example, you can't craft padded armor, robes, leather armor, etc.

~Thick Feet~.Effect: Your movement speed can't be reduced below 4, and you are immune to being Slowed and to Hard Terrain.
~Thick Feet~.Notes: You are not immune to Roots.

~Runesmith~.Effect:
You permanently know 2 Basic Abilities from the Arcane or Mysticism Basic Ability Lists.
You become Skilled in Arcane (see Skills).
~Runesmith~.Notes:
You can't change these Spells, so choose wisely.
You must still respect the Level requirement for these Spells, if any.

~Nap Time~.Effect: You can spend 12 hours sleeping to recover 5 Health.

Extras: Free food and shelter in taverns
~Skill of Trade~.Effect:
Your Charisma increases by 1 (up to a maximum of +3).
You gain an extra +5 to Checks when checking environment elements made of stone.
You can get free shelter and food in inns and taverns (if you would normally be able to pay for them).

~Meditation~.Effect:
As an Elf, your sleep is more akin to meditation and you only need 4 hours of sleep per night.
Elves don't dream and can still hear and smell while sleeping, but at a lower responsiveness.

~Gene Diversity~.Effect: When creating your character, choose 3 Elf Talents from below instead of 1.

~Arcane Veins~.Effect: You have access to the Arcane Spell School, no matter what Class you are.

~Fae Veins~.Effect: You have access to the Nature Spell School, no matter what Class you are.

~The Blade Dance~.Effect: When YOU kill a Worthy Enemy, replenish all your Movement and you can Break your Movement this turn.

~Lithe~.Effect: When targeted by an attack or Spell and you are at or below 25% Health, if there is another viable Player Character the attack can target, you can force the Enemy to target that Player Character instead.

~Mana Block~.Effect: A Unit within 3 meters becomes Silenced.
~Mana Block~.Downside: Only usable on Units with Charisma is lower than yours.
~Mana Block~.Notes: As such, you always know if a Unit's Charisma is lower than yours.

~Swift Sprint~.Effect: Move up to ~3 meters and remove any Slow or Root effect on your~.
~Swift Sprint~.Notes:
Sprint is a default move everyone can do; Swift Sprint allows you to move 3 meters instead of 2, and remove Slow and Root effects.
When you Sprint, you can move even if you already moved this turn.

~Agile Technique~.Effect: You can use any weapon with your Dexterity Stat (e.g. instead of Might).

~Sword Tradition~.Effect: You can use any sword or bow regardless of its Stat requirements, and you can inscribe 1 extra Rune on any sword or bow.
~Sword Tradition~.Notes: Inscribing a weapon with the extra Rune makes the weapon Soulclaimed by you, and can't be used by another Character until the Rune is removed.

~Disenchant Magic~.Effect: Destroy a Magic Item equipment piece to permanently gain its Magic Item properties.
~Disenchant Magic~.Notes: E.g. you disenchant Gloves of Athletics to permanently gain Skilled in Athletics, or you disenchant Gloves of Eldritch Blast to permanently gain the power to cast Eldritch Blast with a Half-Action once per Adventure.

Extras: You age from time, but age when depressed, anxious, angry, etc. Your colors and dreams are vivid.
You don't have a sense of taste.
~Inherited Tastes~.Effect:
As a Gnome, you don't age from the passing of time. Instead, you age more rapidly when you are suffering emotionally (about 10 times faster than a human, in periods when you're depressed, anxious, fearful, etc).

You don't have a sense of taste, but your eyes perceive colors sharper than other races.

Gnomes' daydreams tend to be very vivid, almost as vivid as regular dreams at night or akin to hallucinations.

~Lucky Presence~.Effect: After another Unit you can see of you makes a roll, you can force them to reroll one die once and keep the new result.
~Lucky Presence~.Upgrade: At Level 4, you can use this twice per Adventure.

~Quick to Act~.Effect:
You don't roll for Initiative.
Your Initiative is always 1 less than the highest Initiative in combat.
~Quick to Act~.Notes: Your Initiative bonus effectively doesn't matter. However, if you get Feats that reduces Initiative, you also subtract that from your Initiative.

Combat Extras: You are immune to being Slowed and Rooted
~Catch Me If You Can~.Effect: You are immune to being Slowed and Rooted.

Extras: You can detect poison (safely) by licking it.
~Oh, My Tongue!~.Effect:
You now have a sense of taste. Congratulations!
You can detect whether something is poisonous by licking it without being affected by that poison.
You have 50% resistance to Acid and Poison.

~Luckier~.Effect: You can use Lucky Presence once more per Adventure.

~Environmentalist~.Effect:
You can move normally through Hard Terrain.
You gain access to the Nature Basic Ability List, regardless of your Class.

~Little Handed~.Effect:
You can move through spaces of enemy Units.
You can climb and ride on the back of an ally and move with them on their turn (without them having a Speed penalty).

Extras: You are undead and immune to common diseases.
